Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: fan_c_free
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sutton Place for a week of business meetings downtown and my stay on the whole was quite nice. My room was a Deluxe King, which was very roomy and comfortable. Any of the staff members I encountered were very pleasant and seemed committed to making my stay enjoyable. There were little things that could be tweaked, but nothing to make a big deal about. The bathrooms could use some updating and the decor, while lovely in some spots, is a bit tired. Some minor annoyances: there were only 3 pillows on a king sized bed, there were a few 'out-of-orders' on things like ice and pop machines and the remote for the television worked only part of the time. I had the sense that if I'd wanted to make an issue of any of this, the staff would have made a concerted effort to make it right. A high note was the room service! It was prompt and hot and delicious! That is a weak area for some hotels, but not here. Also, room temperature and water temperature were perfect.

Reviews.Title: “No Hot water no fridge”
Reviews.Author: Stephen D
Reviews.Content: When we came we found that there was no fridge in the rooms and much cheaper hotel will have fridges in the room. The hot water in room 1225 did not work properly. We needed to wait 8 minutes until it got hot and then it got cold again after 3 mintues. We eventually changed rooms with no problems. Three different floors did not have there ice machines working. The pool was not working when we were there. Great location for walking around Toronto but I would rather stay outside of Toronto and train in then stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Molly E
Reviews.Content: I'd always heard great things about The Sutton Place, that this was the hotel celebrities chose when coming to Toronto, etc., etc. So I rather thought the place would be much like the Chateau Laurier in Ottawa or the Royal York Hotel in Toronto. As an out-of-towner coming to Toronto for the weekend, I jumped at a deal to stay at The Sutton Place, $125 / night. When we arrived, the front desk staff who checked us in was strictly on auto pilot. She offered little eye contact and just went through the motions. Perhaps she was having an 'off' day. Our room was acceptable, but much smaller than I expected for a fine hotel. It actually felt cramped. However, everything was very clean and the beds were wonderfully comfortable. The one big bone to pick for us was the noise; noise from Bay Street (our room faced Bay) and noise from the hallway and the adjacent rooms. The walls can't be properly soundproofed, and the windows must not have the soundproofing qualities needed to keep street noise at 'bay' (no pun intented). Making matters worse, there was no air conditioning unit or source of white noise in the room to drown out all those irritating sounds. We requested that a fan be sent up to our room and thankfully the hotel obliged. We had it blowing at top speed all night. It was the one thing that allowed us to get some sleep. No doubt a room facing away from Bay Street would take care of the street noise, but there might still be the matter of noisy neighbours and hall walkers. It always puzzles me why some hotels forget about the noise factor. The number one reason people use a hotel is to sleep afterall, and I for one don't sleep well with a freeway under my window.

Reviews.Title: “March Break Stay”
Reviews.Author: Karl R
Reviews.Content: My Son and I took a trip to TO to see the Mayan show at the ROM and we stayed at the Sutton Place while in Toronto. First the Good... Nice large comfortable room with double bed. The hotel in general is nice but it is showing it's age now. Lots of parking at $25 / day. A bit over priced, but it's average for the city. Helpful doormen and concierge. Now the Bad... I was close to the elevators and at first it wasn't much of a deal, however, as the night wore on it became a constant noise you couldn't get away from. The TV remote was either broken or in need of some fresh battery. The toilet flushed only after many attempts. No fans in the bathrooms. I don't think the ice bucket and tongs have been clean in a week, so sticky I washed them myself. Now the Ugly... After the first night wondering what that smell was... I discovered a rotting apple under my bed. Clearly from a previous guest, but the staff missed it after their "cleaning" then and again after my first night cleaning. Since it had that "cider" smell I would guess it had been their for at least 4 days. As I checked out, the front desk staff didn't even ask how my stay was, just wanted a to know how I would pay my parking bill. I told them about my experience and they took notes and said they would tell the cleaning staff. No offer to make it right, no apologies, just a thanks for coming. I see no compelling reason to return the the Sutton Place in Toronto for business or pleasure. Especially considering the large number of alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business stay”
Reviews.Author: CanadaJeff
Reviews.Content: The front desk was friendly and quick. The room was large and the desk and chair were comfortable. The bed was great...very comfortable. Centrally located downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Hannan G
Reviews.Content: It was a real value for money, excellent location. good for those of highly conscious about immaculate, top range hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A Touch of Class”
Reviews.Author: adele08wall
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that we have stayed at this hotel. The first time was on our honeymoon 41 years ago. It is an old classic hotel that has been upgraded and beautifully enhanced. The rooms are very large and the decor is very comfortable. We have still not had the time to use the pool or spa on our stay but they are available. From the moment we drove up and were greeted by a friendly doorman the service was excellent. The hotel is kept in immaculate condition. This stay we ordered room service for breakfast and everything was delicious and elegantly delivered.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable and smiling staff”
Reviews.Author: salmonangler
Reviews.Content: from the moment we parked the car, having been guided to a perfect spot by the valet in the garage - smiling at check in and room exactly as we had booked on-line - smiling from housekeeping staff - very nice breakfast again with welcoming smiling staff - could not ask for better - this hotel is just the right size and everyone we had dealings with made us feel at home - is this not the way it should be with hotels!!

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, bit of a walk!”
Reviews.Author: Marnie72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, on a weekend trip to shop. Was a nice older hotel. Rooms were huge, they had very comfortable beds. We booked on hotwire and they were more than happy to accommodate a request for 2 double beds. As we were shopping, the Eaton Centre was quite a walk away, and we were tired after a day of shopping then a long walk back. The concierge was very helpful. Staff were good on a whole, however we did ring down for Kleenex and never received. 24 hour Tim Hortons opposite was awesome. One block down from the subway was very handy! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: robsan555
Reviews.Content: I have driven by this Hotel for many years. I finally stayed one night with the family. If the walls could talk there would be many celebrity stories to tell. The Hotel is old, but has its original charm. The breakfast was great. The only issue I had was the temperature. The thermostat was not working properly and the temperature would go to high and then we had to wake up to adjust it downward and atleast once more to raise it. This is a big pain when you are with small kids.

Reviews.Title: “â€œContinues to be the best place to stay in Torontoâ€�”
Reviews.Author: julia111Ottawa
Reviews.Content: I am presently sitting in one of my favourite apartments at my home away from home, The Sutton Place Hotel, Toronto, on one of my many visits to Toronto. I have read with perplexity a few reviews of this hotel criticizing the staff. I have no idea where these complainers are coming from. The individuals on staff at the Sutton Place Hotel Toronto are wonderful. I continue to come here as I have been for eleven years or so now, approximately five times a year, sometimes more, for 10 days to two weeks at a time and I am always received courteously, with warmth even when the front desk staff are at their busiest. The housekeeping staff are responsive, polite and kind always trying to provide anything I ask for. The restaurant staff are friendly and accommodating, the concierges are knowledgeable and helpful. The doormen are efficient and welcoming. The various managers are responsible and serviceable. What more could you want? For the price this is the best central accommodation in The Yorkville/University of Toronto/ROM area and the best in the city in my opinion. Some people are just picky and too hard to please I suppose. Everyone who works at this hotel is obviously dedicated to their job and involved in a personable way with clients who come and go. I believe that it is the staff, their flexibility and their amenability that have made the Sutton Place Toronto a home away from home for the many of us who are not impossible to please. My philosophy at this hotel is: Don't expect the kind people who work here to read your mind. Ask and ye shall receive, or at least serious efforts will be made to please you. Kudos to the staff here for making my stay in Toronto comfortable and pleasant, once again.

Reviews.Title: “Faded”
Reviews.Author: JamesII
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two and a half weeks in the Sutton Place. I haven't stayed at the Sutton Place before and was really kind of looking forward to it. The common areas are really quite nice but the rooms are faded and there is a general sense that the place though once glorious hasn't been kept up. I heard that there may be plans to develop the property and thus no new money is going into it. The pool is closed and the exercise equipment ( which is a bit confusing to get to) is really out of date. The cleaning staff is only there part of the day. I had to switch rooms mid-stay due to street noise from Bay Street (I couldn't get to sleep most nights). Even on the other side of the hotel the street noise was significant. Unfortunately I can't say as I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was So-so”
Reviews.Author: VGSLondon_Ontario
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room consisted of a suite which was a pleasant surprise. The room was clean, but very, very noisy. There was the constant traffic noise of Bay Street which we heard in our room, and we were right beside the elevators that we also constantly heard. I was pleased to return home to peace and quiet! Internet and WiFi was an additional charge, which in this day and age should have been included. We had a terrible dinner in the Accents restaurant. The food arrived cold, and was very, very bland. Yes, the location was central to Bloor Street, but not much else!

Reviews.Title: “Mom & Daughter City Trip”
Reviews.Author: DiscoveringPlaces
Reviews.Content: Overall a very, very enjoyable stay. Large, clean room featuring white bedding! Morning newspaper outside the door. A great location within easy walking and subway distance to a multitude of Toronto attractions and shopping. I found WiFi reception somewhat inconsistent but this trip was a holiday... I look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Aging but well-maintained, good location”
Reviews.Author: bbanks945
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place was a swish location forty years ago. Today, it's an aging beauty - well maintained but in need of a serious makeover. It was upstaged by the Four Seasons and the Park Hyatt on Bloor, and now the Windsor Arms. For mid-range accommodation, it competes against the monstrous Delta Chelsea a bit to the south. This is not an ultra-efficient business hotel. It is fine for mid-range travel and, if you get a better deal than the Delta Chelsea it's fine for family travel. If you need proximity to Queen's Park or University of Toronto, it's also fine.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in the city”
Reviews.Author: LDV15
Reviews.Content: Booked Sutton hotel via priceline or hotwire, I don't remember but I do remember it was a good rice for that weekend as a lot of the hotels were 150+ for that night. We got a corner suite (living area separated by a closed door to the bedroom) The washroom was mediocre--nothing special. The bed was quite comfortable and the TV was standard. The view was not the best and the living room furnitures were dated. Since our room was a room within another room which was within another door that led to the actual hall, it was super peaceful and quiet. Overall, very convenient location and good value for its money for downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: lynnhoops
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently returned from a 6 day/5 night belated Christmas visit to Toronto. We had a lovely time visiting friends & family, sightseeing, shopping, and dining out. However, the trip was soured in great part by our stay at the Sutton Place Hotel, which was terrible.. We booked through Hotwire.ca and got a good price for a Queen bed room. Upon arrival we were given a room with a queen bed in it, sure enough. However, the room was apparently created from some sort of storage area: very small, low ceiling, peeling wallpaper placed over cracked walls with mildew and mould, a tiny closet, an out of date, dingy bathroom, a burned out lightbulb in the desk lamp, etc. I called the front desk, asked for another room and said the one assigned was not satisfactory, whereupon the desk clerk snapped â€œwhatâ€™s wrong with itâ€�. When I started to explain the roomâ€™s deficiencies, she cut me off and said "Fine, we'll switch you". There was no apology, nor offer to come up with another set of keys or request for us to return to the front desk. We went back to the front desk where I was asked by the desk clerk "Are you the one who wants a new room". I explained that, yes, I was, and thanked her for accommodating us. As I turned away with the new keys, my partner observed that the clerk looked me up and down and made a rude face in my direction. While unpacking, we noted there were no robes in the closet, as advertised. We called down and requested that 2 be brought up. We tipped for this service. We toured the hotel and stopped in the main floor bistro for drinks and a snack. The attitude of the waiter left much to be desired, as though we were inconveniencing him by sitting in his area. Note: another evening, same waiter, same attitude. The housekeeping staff was a whole gem unto its own. Three days in a row the counters and mirrors were not wiped (coffee stains and splattered toothpaste marks were present before and after "cleaning"), The floor wasn't swept/mopped, as evidenced by a disposable contact lens and Q-tip on the floor beside the emptied waste basket when we walked in after cleaning was done. The bathtub wasn't washed, as evidenced by the hairs in the tub. Hmmmmmmm.... guess who didn't have a bath during their stay??? My small bottles of salon shampoo and conditioner, filled to the top on day 1, mysteriously were half-empty on day 4. I only use 1 tbsp per shampoo and was surprised to see so much missing when I next showered. We asked for a non-smoking room, which we received. However, there were smokers in other rooms on the floor, one in particular smoking cigar(s)... It was nauseating having to pass through the stench of the smoke as we went to and from the elevators each time. On our final night, a group of 18-20 yr olds stayed in the rooms beside and across the hall from us. From 9:00pm until 11:30pm they yelled, swore, slammed the doors as they ran back and forth, their dog (!!) barked. We called security at 11:00pm and complained, and were told that only because it was after 11:00, a security person would be sent up to speak with the guests. The guard told the partiers that there had been a complaint about the noise and could they "keep it down and not slam the doors". Of course the idiots said "sure, sure, we're going out anyway"; after another half hour of yelling and door slamming, left. We feared that they would return in an even worse state when the nightclubs closed. Sure enough, at 2:00am, we were awakened to loud swearing, yelling in the room next to us as well as in the hall, and doors to both rooms slamming. Despite another warning by Security, the noise/fighting continued and the offending guests were not asked to leave. Kudos must be given to the young woman on the front desk when we checked out the next day. We had been charged for an extra nightâ€™s parking and made mention of this to her. She immediately adjusted our bill and apologized for the error. My partner mentioned the disruption to our previous night and asked what the hotel was prepared to do in compensation. The young woman listened to our complaint and immediately offered to remove some charges from our bill, which we accepted. The only other â€œpositiveâ€� encountered during our stay at the Sutton Place was the discovery of the hotel spaâ€™s registered massage therapist, Raissa Trusevych. This young woman works pure magic on aching muscles. The spa itself is old and in need of major renovation. Fortunately one may book an appointment with her at the local clinic where she also works

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Robin M
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight while in Toronto for a job interview. Check-in and out was quick and easy. Staff were friendly and welcoming. The hotel was clean, gorgeous and the guest room was really nice. French-style ambiance which I love. Definitely had that high class feel for an amazing price (got the winter sale). Ordered room service for breakfast for the first time ever, I was very impressed, it was a gourmet breakfast for sure and the juice really was fresh squeezed. Our only disappointment was that we were only there for the one night. I would have liked to stay longer to really enjoy the experience. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: LucaEmma
Reviews.Content: The rooms at Sutton Place have been recently renovated. Ours was fresh, clean, and very spacious. Nothing extraordinary, but nice robes and bath products. We stayed in January, so we probably enjoyed a low-season rate, and the best shopping and dining was within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A nice old world charm, albeit with a touch of faded bygone glory”
Reviews.Author: jmw245
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference and it reminded of Park Plaza hotel of Boston, though far better in upkeep. Still it reflected a bygone era of brilliance. The room was huge but the bathroom needs updating. If you request, the bath robe delivered is of superb quality. One night I ordered room service, the young green and black cod was surprisinly delicious, and with all the specifics I gave during the meal order, it was delivered without a mishap, nothing like all the Hyatt hotels in the US where something always went wrong in food ordering. Front desk staff is not particularly friendly or warm and fuzzy, but they are very efficient. Overall, at the rate we paid, it is a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the incidentals!”
Reviews.Author: megse
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. Checkin in was smooth - the staff was professional, but not particularly friendly. We stayed in a standard king room, however, we had placed a request for two beds prior to our arrival. While I love my sister, we had not shared a bed since we were wee ones. The front desk staff gave us a terse "we are sold out" response. While we were offered a cot, there was an incidental charge. The room itself was spacious and tastefully decorated. The hotel has the charm of the older railway hotels. In fact, its the more classical of hotels in Toronto. A standard room does not include items such as a fridge. The location of the hotel is rather convenient to stores along Bloor (H&M, Chapters, The Bay, Michael Kors). The real downside came from over $200 in incidentals alone. I wouldn't describe this hotel as "pet friendly." I have a small dog and traditionally, I don't have to pay for pet stays. A charge in this case was fine ($50), but travelers should keep this in mind before booking at this "pet friendly" location. Local calls are not free (!), internet was a charge (!) and there was a charge for the business centre as well (!). Parking is actually rather competitive compared to other hotels in the downtown. I would stay at the hotel again considering I think the charm outweighs the cost. Be smart - tether instead of paying for internet, leave fido at home, and well...your on your own if you have to share a bed with your sister.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasent time”
Reviews.Author: beach_bum6d9
Reviews.Content: REASON FOR MY STAY: Concert â€“ girlsâ€™ night out CHECK IN: I bought a deal for this hotel, for a concert that me and my friends were going to, therefore the price was very good. The check in went smoothly, expect when it came to the lady telling us where to self park my friends car. She acted offended that we didnâ€™t want someone else to park her car and dismissed us shortly after. ROOM: the room was big with older very well kept furniture; however the bathroom was tiny and just old. Nothing really special. CHECKOUT: quick and smooth. Other Comments: The hotel is in a nice location to the air Canada centre. There are signs everywhere regarding any kind of nice complains will be punished with being asked to leave the hotel. Over all, it is a nice hotel with a classy touch.

Reviews.Title: “Strange decision...”
Reviews.Author: Swanseaexile
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before so booked for three nights over new year. The hotel is fine, but unfortunately, when booking, we failed to appreciate that all refreshment facilities including the restaurant, bar and room service were unavailable for some three weeks. Frankly, a hotel of this class and charging what it does should have shut down completely if it was unable to provide any refreshments whatsoever over Christmas and New Year.

Reviews.Title: “Summer fun”
Reviews.Author: Kayura84
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through Hotwire.com and was well worth the money. The room was huge with a king bed and lots of closet space. My boyfriend thought the bathroom was on the small side but I thought it was better then most I've stayed in. We were in town for Fan Expo and loved that the subway was so close to the hotel and a direct line to Union Station. We didn't have any problems or order room service so I can't really comment on the staff but the Front Desk was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Apparently once glamorous”
Reviews.Author: exile_on_bank_street
Reviews.Content: The hotel has some dings and scrapes in it but nothing out of the ordinary, just a 1970s hotel. The room that I was in was in good shape. I had trouble figuring out the shower. The tub was very springy, as if part of the support of the tub had gone missing. There was a switch to turn on the light in the hall but there wasn't a switch to turn on the lights in the main part of the room. You needed to go around to to each lamp to manually turn them on. The switches were difficult to access and each lamp had a different type of switch. It was fairly quiet. The bed was comfortable. The room had an adjustable thermostat. The radio was not difficult to program; you'll be surprised at how difficult some can be. There wasn't a robe in the room, which I would have thought would have been there given the class of hotel. The location is good. It is close to restaurants -- there's one across the road, two in the building next door (plus a burger joint and a pub) and a fair number up Bay street. A block east of the hotel is Yonge street. Yorkville is 5 minutes walk. If you can't find a restaurant there you are beyond hope. West of the hotel is the U of T. Bay street south of Wellesley is a desert.

Reviews.Title: “moved out after the first night!”
Reviews.Author: malibumomof7
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it had 2 bedroom suites and I had stayed there 10 years ago and enjoyed it. Apparently, it has not been updated since. The windows leaked, the restaurants were all closed (including the room service) as was the pool. It was empty and i know why.The concierge was helpful as was the staff but they neglected to tell us that all of the services were down when we reserved the room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfunctory”
Reviews.Author: AlanaPot
Reviews.Content: Lovely but bland rooms with a balcony view. The bathrooms also are tiny. This was a good stay but service was given to the value of the last cent. Very reminiscent of a parking meter. Unless you are satisfied with bistro-style food the hotel is also rather far from restaurants and nightlife. At least room service had a small but decent menu. We were here as a couple, perhaps a business traveler will find the Sutton more suitable.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Sutton”
Reviews.Author: Goplacesfromhere
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and will be back the location and the price suit our needs. We like the the windows in the room can open and that the rooms are large. There is lots of closet space to put suitcase out of the way and you can control the heat in your room. I like the large lobby and it had a huge real Christmas tree and looked very pretty. It is a bit dated but that is part of its charm. We have had better rooms at the Sutton it was on the 5th floor with 2 double beds. Comfortable and quiet sleep and the walls are thick enough we can stay up watching Tv and talking without disturbing others. But it could have been cleaner and the toilet handle kept falling off. A very dirty blue throw pillow was on the bed and the carpet needed a better vacuum. The desk staff was nice but seeing it was December 25th I would have liked a bit extra - like fresh cookies or even candycanes at the desk. The pool is under construction but I understand places needed to renovate from time to time. I look forward to using the new pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, upscale accomodations”
Reviews.Author: renrenren
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Upscale lobby. Friendly staff. Quick check-in. Too bad that in 2011, some of these properties are still charging for internet when all of the discount hotels offer it for free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice typical North American hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_and_Johan
Reviews.Content: My wife usually stays here when she is in Toronto for work and I am staying for the fouth time now. The hotel is very well placed if you need to be in the Young and Bloor area. The hotel is "old style" but is very well kept and feels rather fresh. The beds are very nice. The room service breakfast is one of my highlights with a healthy fruit and berry platter. The health club is OK, pretty old equipment and the pool is closed, again. We haven't used any of the other amenities. I do recommend the hotel, fair price and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: iczi
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel, stayed during the holidays so the hotel was nicely decorated which added to it's older flare. The rooms are filled with classic furniture and very spacious, some wear and tear of course but nothing uncomfortable. Check-in/outs were very convenient, with late check outs available (4pm). The parking is located right below the hotel for $25/night. Room service was a little disappointing - we ordered an omelet and french toast. When it arrived the french toast was cold as if it was sitting there for awhile. Overall, it is a gorgeous and quiet hotel that is suitable for a romantic evening or a relaxing night. A lovely change from cookie-cutter modern hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: agac
Reviews.Content: obtained a very good rate on priceline. hotel is located near the trendy yorkville area. It is an easy 10 minute walk to the eaton centre. Parking is available at hotel for $25, but there is metered parking on wellesley street, for those with a disabled parking permit, you obtain free parking all the time. Check in was very fast, staff were very friendly. We were fortunate to obtain a corner unit on the 5th floor. Room was clean, though very cold as the heat had been turned off. The decor is not modern, i would describe it as dated but still "in". There were 2 closets with a safe. the bathroom was on the small/average side, the only complaint was that there was no water pressure around 5 pm, though it was fine in the morning. we had a king, it was very comfortable, the only issue was the pillows- a choice of very hard or very soft. as it was a corner room it faced bay street and the side street, there was some street noise from bay street, but what do you expect you are in the downtown of a big city, it did not bother us. the tv was a flat screen. Check out was very quick, and staff once again very friendly having been asked if everything was fine. There is tim hortons and convenience store accross the street, with lots of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, better for business trips”
Reviews.Author: chcui
Reviews.Content: stayed couple nights via expedia for about 140/night. Fair location, minutes to the subway and Yonge street. Internet is expensive, breakfast is too but pretty good~

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for business meetings/conferences!”
Reviews.Author: DrunkInCubaNow
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in The Sutton Place Hotel as part of a conference... We were in the main conference area and we also split into the Rosedale room and Paris room. The reception floor is quite nice, the service is excellent and the meeting rooms were well lit room with an elegant projector set up. I was also surprise with the quality of the coffee served at breaks... My only complaint was that the ceilings are low and there are no windows in the main conference area... but overall this is a great location for conferences of less than 100 people (especially when you consider the proximity to the subway and to downtown).

Reviews.Title: “Great value - if you get a deal!”
Reviews.Author: senator_br
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel with online hotel deal site and was pleased enough with the sites choice. Large hotel room (queen bed), large screen tv, tiny bathroom, and no continental breakfast except in the restaurant inside hotel. Was not expecting doorman so this is a little higher than what I am used to staying in but the room was exceptionally clean!! Check in and out was efficient and quick. Only stayed one night so there was not much info to go on. The windows did let in a lot of sound. Bed was comfortable but the bottom fitted sheet was made for a standard mattress, this bed had a pillow top style so the sheet didn't fit properly just brought the classiness of the place down a notch. Overall good hotel but get a deal do not pay regular price!

Reviews.Title: “Not if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: SambenOntario
Reviews.Content: I travel to Toronto a few times a year for business and generally stay at four star properties. Having never stayed at the Sutton Place before, I was quite looking forward to my night there. First, the good. The location is great, a short walk to the subway station, reasonable parking rates ($25/day) and an easy walk to Yonge St and Bloor St. The hotel is very clean and full of marble and shiny brass like most others. I was given a room on the fourth floor. My room was quite large, although the bathroom was quite small. Nice queen bed and modern television, clean, but a little tired and dated. Bed was clean and comfortable. Now the not so good. When booking a hotel, there are two overriding features for me: a good night sleep and a good shower in the morning. Here the Sutton Place fails miserably. As my lower floor room was located close to the corner of Bay and Wellesley Streets, I got to listen to road noise until the wee hours when exhaustion finally over took aggrevation and I finally fell asleep. Sleep was short lived as the early morning commuter traffic quickly replaced the nightcrawlers and I was once again resting, but not sleeping at the Sutton. The hotel can't help the road noise, but they can surely use noise insulating glass etc like others do to drown out the outside noise. Still cranky from the lack of sleep, I got up to have a shower. Here, like most other major hotels, the Sutton has managed to restrict the amount of water flow so that it still counts as a shower even though you barely get wet. I am not sure what this flow rate is, but it doesn't seem to matter how much a room costs, all hotel managers have this secret formula to make sure only minimal water actually reaches the tired traveller. Nothing like an invigorating trickle to get the blood flowing in the morning. If you can stay here on the cheap, it is a nice place, but don't break the bank hoping for something special.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location - excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Spunky56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Sutton Place Hotel on Friday, November 25, 2011 for one night. We bought this stay through travel deal website for $130 which included the one night's stay, $25 credit to be used for food and beverages including alcohol and 30% off spa services. Check in was very efficient - front desk staff very friendly and informative. Very classy foyer. Our room was a standard room with a king-sized bed - very, very nice - flat screen TV, beautiful furniture, great bedding and fluffy towels. You can request robes if you wish. There is an in-room bar that you can call housekeeping to unlock for you. The bathroom is very nicely appointed. All in all, a very comfortable room. We were able to walk to our concert at Massey Hall enjoying the Christmas lights and sights and sounds of Toronto. When we got back from the concert, we used our $25 credit to order a caesar salad and nachos from room service - the food was excellent and arrived at our room well under the 20 minutes promised. The pool was under renovation but that was fine since we really didn't have time to use it. The on-site restaurant, Accents, looked very nice and the prices were very reasonable - we just didn't have an opportunity to use it. We would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Desk staff”
Reviews.Author: G P
Reviews.Content: You will find a theme through many of the reviews here-- unfriendly desk staff. I don't know why it still is a problem for this hotel, it can't be that they are unaware.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, especially if you paid a rate under $150”
Reviews.Author: bangkokreviewer
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant stay. Great location and room was really clean. Staff was friendly. I got the morning paper on both of the mornings that coincided with my stay. The balcony was all a little bit iffy and the bathroom was indeed small - but it was really clean and not moldy so it was quite comfy for me. Initially, I was worried because people had posted some really negative reviews - I had gotten this hotel thru a 4 star toronto east hotwire bid for 235 usd including taxes and fees. All in all, a very pleasant stay - especially for the price. the only rather significant negative in my eyes was that i wanted a late checkout and they could only give me until 1pm ...

Reviews.Title: “So-so experience.”
Reviews.Author: Leem0m
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok. Our king room was spacious and clean and the linens were nice. The noise from the hallway and from the street was quite loud. Front desk staff was friendly. No bathrobes in our room and no morning newspaper. We have stayed previously and it seems like it might be going downhill somewhat. I heard that there was either new management or new owners so that might be part of the problem, hope they can bring it up to former standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal made up for no pool”
Reviews.Author: edemec
Reviews.Content: Another week night jaunt to downtown Toronto. I found a great rate for the Tuesday night to save me the trek to Burlington and back and was thrilled that The Sutton Place Hotel had a pool. I made my booking the night before my check-in and Expedia advised that their restaurant was under renovation, so was closed, but no mention of the pool. I checked their website the day of my stay only to find out about the closed pool. Check-in was smooth, the room was very nice (1724 corner room with north-east views) but had no bar fridge which I find useful for wine and breakfast items. Bathroom was nice and a bit dated. I needed extra cream for my morning coffee and they sent it up within 5 minutes, so service was good. The Sutton Place Hotel is in a great location for restaurants, theatres and shopping and served its purpose for me. The rate made the lack of pool more acceptable but I would have really enjoyed a swim.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing second visit”
Reviews.Author: lovepuntacana_9
Reviews.Content: We ordered a corkscrew and after waiting about 45 minutes, called again before one was delivered promptly. I called the concierge at approx 6:30pm to get directions to a dinner destination . The call went to voicemail - the message reviewed the concierge desk hours of operation (which fell during the time of my call) and asked to leave a message and the desk would return the call. I left a message. No return call. After about a half hour, I decided to call the front desk -They told me there is no one at the concierge desk- I questioned why that would be when the concierge message clearly stated they were available until 11pm- the front desk then transferred me to another person (i have no idea who) but that person then transferred me to the concierge. The concierge responded to my questions regarding distance and transportation to my dinner destination but when I asked if reservations were required for this restaurant, I was told I could call them. Only when I questioned if this would cost me to make a local from the hotel did the concierge offer to make the reservations for me. Perhaps I am wrong but I thought that was what their job was? The hotel was not full, nor was it overly busy. I saw about other three other patrons during my stay -which indicates to me it was far from busy... This was my second visit to the Sutton. The first time I did not require any any service from the hotel staff so I am not sure if this is unusual but I certainly hope so. During both of my visits, I rented two connecting rooms. They were very clean, spacious and comfortable. It would be a shame if I had to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel represents poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Maclock
Reviews.Content: From the unhelpful valet/bellman on duty the night that I checked in, to the garage open to the public that is left unattended and thus vulnerable to break-ins for four hours each night, to the tattered rooms, The Sutton Place Hotel represents poor value for money. In my room, holes were found in the wall where something that once was wall-mounted had been removed and no attempt had been made to fill them in with spackling, black mold was found around the tub caulking, a proper cleaning of the shower enclosure was long overdue, an exposed corner in the room hadn't been protected with plastic edging and was tattered as a result, the blackout curtains had degraded to the point that there was a hole in one of them, a cheap toilet seat and seat lid were used to replace what I expect were once a good quality toilet seat and seat lid, a wrapped roll of toilet paper was left atop the toilet water tank, and the communicating door to an adjoining room had been left unlocked. All-in-all, this place is not well-run and I won't return here until some serious changes are made for the better. I'd advise you to spend your money elsewhere for the time being.

Reviews.Title: “Other than some construction across the road on the east side, no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: jjhrad
Reviews.Content: Service was very good, room was very comfortable. Until early 2012, I would recommend asking for a room on the west side facing Bay Street due to nearby construction. Good location for U of T, Yorkville shopping, Yonge Street. Subway is a block away on Yonge at Wellesley.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Skullery_Made
Reviews.Content: It was a great spot to be in! Close to Everything that I needed or Wanted! I would totally stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown convenience!”
Reviews.Author: KLK62
Reviews.Content: We visited the Sutton Place Hotel on a Jaunt coupon. We had a large room with a comfy King size bed. The hotel was convenient to the Eaton Centre, subway stops and window shopping along Yonge Street. We also enjoyed a glass of wine in the bright and cheery bar area. We would stay there again. Visit Bistro 990 right across the street for some delicious and affordable French cuisine!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the expected level”
Reviews.Author: IslandTraveller
Reviews.Content: Very tired. You are better off at other Toronto hotels. I stay at the Vancouver Sutton on a regular basis and the 2 are not comparable. The staff in Vancouver are welcoming, the Toronto staff could not care less. The Toronto hotel is no longer part of the Sutton's Prestige program and no wonder why?

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, good position”
Reviews.Author: Susyz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the first stop of our honeymoon, therefore all was very nice and the hotel was exactly what we espected. We stayed there 2 nights, but we would have stayed there more nights! ROOM: we were at the 18th floor, the view was nice, especially in the night. The room was very clean, very large and elegant, with a wonderful big bed, very comfortable. The bathroom was clean, comfortable and bright, there were two sinks and a large mirror. maybe the tub was a bit small. STAFF: staff was very nice,like all Canadians I would say. When we arrived a porter accompained us in the room and we found our luggage directly in the room. Every day we found a newspaper hung at the door. POSITION: the hotel was in toronto downtown, we could reach CN Tower in about 5 minutes with the cab, about 25 minutes on foot. Walking to the centre in the morning is fascinating if you haven't ever been in a "skyscraper city" in your life! TORONTO: toronto is a city to see. View from CN Tower is amazing, Toronto Island is quiet and relaxing, skyline from there is spectacular. Don't forget to have a breakfast at Starbucks (is about 2 minutes from the hotel) and if possible book a dinner at Arriba Restaurant near, or better, on the Roger Centre: we went there during a baseball match (Red Socks vs. Jays) and it was so special, the tables were overlooking the stadium. Staff of Arriba Restaurant was so nice with us: they knew we were there for our honeymoon and so as a dessert they gave us a present, strawberries with chocolate: very sweet from them! We love Toronto and Canadian people, all was very very special.

Reviews.Title: “Review your bill before checking out!”
Reviews.Author: eliana1110
Reviews.Content: Several things about this hotel: 1. You need to specifically request a balcony. Not all rooms have them 2. Request a room facing Wellesley and NOT Bay St, as you will be facing a tall building with offices looking right into your room! We couldn't open the curtains during the day! 3. Be prepared to pay $25 a day for overnight parking. I guess parking in downtown Toronto is expensive everywhere. 4. We were charged over $100 extra for the 4 days of parking. I do double check the bill before leaving a hotel, and even though they said at the front desk that they will fix their error, our credit card was charged, and now I am dealing with their accounting department. Just too much hassle to deal with after a trip! On a positive note, the location is great, just walking distance to the Yorkville area where lots of good (and expensive) restaurants are located! If you like Middle Eastern food, there is an excellent "hole in the wall" place just around the corner. We ate there 3 times! The room was very nice, with a very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: Canadianfb
Reviews.Content: Nice property downtown Toronto, and great location just a few minutes walk from the Eaton Centre. Very disappointing breakfast: we had Continental buffet on day 1, and this was the poorest choice I have seen in a very long time (4 types of fruits, Danish pastry not fresh, and yogurt)!! And for $15 per person! On day 2 we decided to take the plated american breakfast, but nothing great either, and cold scrambled eggs! Hotel room was spacious and clean. front desk staff was welcoming and concierge was great with information about the city and Niagara falls, where we travelled next. Car parking is big, and with a fair price for the location. We will surely go back, but avoid the restaurant for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Too expensive. Needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: SDubois
Reviews.Content: Favorable location near the University of Toronto. Otherwise, the place is pretty dated and too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre....Really needs some love”
Reviews.Author: ramblingsalesman
Reviews.Content: While it was acceptable that's about it. Room was clean but dated, staff were efficient but abrupt. Was forced to sign a long policy on no guests in my room.......which was very strange, even my parents didn't have such a strange policy when I was 12. I'm not scared of staying there again but not my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nasty”
Reviews.Author: Alfred P
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the lady at the front desk was talking on the phone the whole time and didn't bother telling us which floor or which room we were in. We had to look it up ourselves. When we got to our floor we thought we went into a 70's apartment building which was never renovated. We were quite surprised when we opened the door as it was a suite (we asked for a double room), but it was also where the nightmare began. Filthy carpet, a big hole in the wall, stained sheets, and the very small bathroom that was never properly cleaned for ages. Kitchen was also a little creppy with a loud fridge and very old microwave and dishwasher. When we checked out (we were only there for one night) we were never asked how they stay was - maybe they already knew it was bad. Very disappointing, will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Dated, Expensive With Small Rooms - STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: RhondaC.
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room for my husband and I. However, my sister entered hospice just prior to our trip, so I told my husband to go ahead and go, and to take our 17 year old son along instead of me. (I was glad I did not go, because my sister passed while they were gone.) Upon checking in, they only offered a single queen bed - FOR TWO GROWN MEN!! For a "4 Star" hotel, it should have been either a king bed or two queen beds. They refused to upgrade the room, and then charged an additional $40 per night to bring in an uncomfortable roll-away cot for my son to sleep on. In addition, the entire hotel is VERY dated and tired and in desperate need of an update. All-in-all, a horrible experience, and especially under these specific circumstances. STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but felt like I was staying at grandmas”
Reviews.Author: Smclaffe
Reviews.Content: Acquired the room on hotwire as a 4 + star hotel. I DONT THINK SO. Ok its clean and in a good location but extras cost to much and the rooms are decorated like my grandmas house. The tv ise the only modern thing in the room. No mp3 plater bring cds. All in all a decenter hotel but wouldnt pay more than whats I paid on hot wire $ 110. I paid $ 95 to stay at the sheraton centre way nicer hotel . Hotwire needs to do some quality control on their star ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Dated...”
Reviews.Author: netgeek
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Sutton Place. The first time (three years ago) I was upgraded to a king suite and it was wonderful. This time I was given a standard room with two beds. The room was quite large, however, it was showing significant signs of wear. The paint was chipped, carpet stained and the room smelt musty. The furnishings attempt to give the room an 'upscale' feel, however, come across as being tacky - something one would expect out of the 1980s. The bathroom was very small and not the most functional. Beds were comfortable. Linens were clean and crisp. Didn't sleep the best because there was a lot of noise coming from the hallway. When in the lobby, on two separate occasions we heard customers arguing with the front desk clerk and vowing never to stay there again. Definitely does not create the most inviting atmosphere. I found the staff to be just OK. There were many bodies in the lobby, however, I am not sure what they were supposed to be doing. They certainly did not go out of their way for us (ie. opening the door). I think that in order for this property to remain competitive, a significant renovation is required. Given that the hotel market in Toronto is rapidly changing (for the better), competition is going to be as tight as ever. I'm not sure how this property could survive in its current condition. Parking was also a bit pricey and internet was $10 a day. Not thrilling.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy C
Reviews.Content: It is the best location in City. Friendly staff, the doorman is great. The hotel is very quiet. The morning breakfast is great. I will be definitely staying there again when I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: LAS_50
Reviews.Content: The location is great for Yorkville and other Bloor Street attractions. Check in was efficient and friendly. The hotel is a bit dated but clean and regal. The room was large but the walls a bit thin (our neighbour watched tv up loud till 3am till we called down to the front desk) I will add that our room was designed to be adjoining with the neighbouring room so that may have had an impact on how much we heard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BarbadosBum
Reviews.Content: First off, I think people are far too critical of this hotel. This is not the Ritz, or the Four Seasons, so don't expect that. I bought a hotel package on hotwire.com and after being notified of what hotel we were given, I immediately checked this hotel on trip advisor. I was a little worried and skeptical when I saw all the negative reviews, but after my experience there, my mind has completely changed. I don't know if I was given a room in a newer part of the hotel, or a room that was just renovated, but I have almost nothing to complain about. Service: Upon check in we were greeted very warmly by two women who immediately upgraded us from our double room, to a king bed suite. We didn't even ask for this, they just did it on their own which was in my opinion, excellent customer service. The lobby was beautiful and all of the staff were very friendly and accommodating, making sure that your every need was met. The Room: Beautiful and clean. Yes, this is an older hotel, however our room was spotless, the beds were very comfortable and we had a nice view from our balcony. We were on the 3rd floor facing east and had no problem with noise from the streets below at night. The rooms are not modern looking, which I was originally worried about after reading about the "old" rooms on tripadvisor. What I found was a room that had tons of character and charm, and unlike a room I have stayed in before. It was like a mix of 1930's glam with the modern amenities of today (flat screen tv, upgraded appliances). I really thought the room was very nice, very comfortable, and extremely clean. Like I said before, I don't know if I stayed in a newer area, but nothing about this room was old and dingy. This kind of leads me to believe that some of the rooms are newer and some are older, because I really don't understand how anyone can complain as much as they have if they stayed in the room that I did. Our coffee pot was brand new, still in the plastic, and sheets looked as though they had been untouched by anyone. The bathroom was spotless, which I rarely say about a hotel. I travel often, so I have seen my share of both good and bad hotel/resort rooms. This was certainly a good one. I did not go higher than the floor I was on, so I can't comment on how higher floors looked. Also, there is room service with a huge menu that looked very good. I didn't order any though because it was very expensive. Location: Decent location, however it is a little far from being right downtown ( CN Tower, ACC,etc). It took about 30-35 mins to walk right downtown, but on a nice day itâ€™s no problem. This hotel is located right across the street to a Tim Hortons which was nice, and also very close to a huge variety of restaurants such as Sushi places, Shawarma, Cafes, Seafood, Steaks, Sandwiches, etc. Every type of food you could want is within a short walking distance. This hotel is about a 15 min walk to the Eaton Centre. My two complaints: The maids/workers in the morning were extremely loud. They were slamming doors ( hopefully not intentionally) constantly from about 730am until around 10am. I think maybe my room was next to a storage closet because you could hear them go in and out almost by the minute. My other complaint, both the AC and the heating were not working, and neither was the fan. I am the type of person that always sleeps with a fan on for black noise, and was somewhat disappointed to find out these didn't work. For me, I know that if the fan was working it would have blocked some of the noise the staff was making in the morning. Also, you have to pay $25 for parking at the hotel. Just an FYI. Overall, I would definitely stay here again and definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. Since I am not sure whether or not some of the rooms are more new/upgraded than others, when you book this hotel I would ask to be put in a newer room, just in case. This hotel was very nice, very clean, and had an old world charm that you don't see too often.

Reviews.Title: “Sure I would try it again (apt. and hotel room)”
Reviews.Author: Kitty K
Reviews.Content: We rented 2 hotel apt. here. When we got there (late check in) our rooms were still not ready. They said we would have about 30 minutes to wait from one room but the other room was just now cleaned. We said ok but that we would have like some discount or something like that for the 30 minutes. Either a discount or late check out something. Then within 2 seconds they had a room ready. Our apt. rentals where side by side. When I opened the door to our apt. I was suprised since it looked nothing like the pictures on line. We started looking around. IN the kitchen there was cake or cooke crumbs all over the floor. My husband checked out the bathroom and came back saying that there was some southern hair on the toilet, on floor and hair on tub. At first (after a long travel) it was like ok we will just clean it up and then I said no way man! We are paying for this room, no room cleaning while we stay here and such.--- We left and went and took a look at our compnaions apt room. They had a much bigger room, clean and it was very nice and much updated. That was enough for me. We went to the desk and I wanted to spk w the clerk that checked me in but she did not want to--- so I spoke to the man that was there and I asked that we spk on the side since my point was not to create a problem. Maybe a maid was having a bad day. I told him the issue and so he asked if he could show me something else and go from there. I said sure. We no longer where on the 27th floor but on the 5th floor but when he opened the door I was floored. It was huge suite. I needed a fridge so we go a fridge for free and internet was also includied. The service I recived from this man was outstanding and I was amazed. I would by far suggest that ppl look into this place however if u do know someone in Toronto I would get them to try and go check out the place for you before booking it. While we stayed there the service was great and wonderful...even our travelling partners had a great time in the apt room they had. So I think that this is very much worth a look and I will stay here again... no questions asked... even in an apt hotel as long as it is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not great for the first two days of your holiday!”
Reviews.Author: magsHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: Oh dear what a shame. The hotel looks nice and the bedroom we were allocated on the 3rd floor was fine BUT we were there midweek when there were conferences. You could hear everything through the inter-connecting door and the landing. I believe they had a breakfast at 6.30am and the noise started about 5.30am. That and the noise from the street made it a miserable experience. We waited 10mins for the lift and once used the stairs so as not to be late. Our waitress at breakfast was absolutely rude, couldn't believe it! We ate once in the restaurant in the evening and he too was rude!! Never was more pleased to leave and move on. I would try somewhere else if I were you. Manners cost nothing!!!!

Reviews.Title: “predictable quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: suebill92
Reviews.Content: NO surprises here at this hotel... parking right on site ($25/day self park, which lets you work out of your car after shopping or extra clothes ). Friendly staff, good location to most of the downtown and just a 10 minute walk to Yorkville. A great restaurant ( well known in TO ) "Bistro 990" is right across the street. Quality food at moderately expensive fare.... no worries after a cocktail and a bottle of wine finding your way home.... The rooms at the Sutton Place are nice and large ( about 600 sq ft. ) well appointed and well maintained... the only downside are the small washrooms which are really not suitable for more than a couple staying in the room. You can`t really go wrong with this hotel or location unless you want to be closer to the St.Lawrence market area. It appears that a lot of business people stay here during the week, and special deals are available on weekends when the hotel wants to fill vacancies. Enjoy...........

Reviews.Title: “3rd time will def not be a charm”
Reviews.Author: kmalik20
Reviews.Content: This hotel lacks customer service. If you have an issue with something such as the miscommunication we had with our dinner voucher and when we could and could not use it during certain times, you are deemed responsible. When no one had explained anything to begin with. To maker matters worse the management will make you feel like your are wrong as well and rather than helping you find a solution and make the customer satisfied he's pointing fingers at you! Because my $175 a night means nothing to you I guess Te whole front end reception has attitude and are not efficient. And this was the second time this has happened. The first time I let it go but when it happened on my next stay that did it for me. You are better off booking at a choicehotel and getting points and being treated like a real customer rather than coming here. I guess the fact that their independently owned their customer service goes down the drain. The rooms are great though, very spacious and a clean, look classy. Too bad the rest of it isn't in synch

Reviews.Title: “Clean but A/C will not work”
Reviews.Author: bartschmid
Reviews.Content: We are here now and the place is well run, clean, but the A/C will not come on. There is hot air coming out of the radiator. They can only run heat or A/C and they are saying that some rooms are too cold so they are going to bring us up a fan. There is a good restaurant right around the corner - Magic Oven which has gluten free items...including pizza and it was good. It was nice to finally have a pizza since I have been gluten free for several months.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: AlanLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: You can usually get an excellent rate online. The hotel is a little old-fashioned, but the rooms are a good size (huge if you get upgraded to a suite) - good value for Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Aled_Vic
Reviews.Content: Travelling as a couple and looking forward to visiting friends in Toronto, we were really disappointed with the Sutton. Would agree with some of the not so positive reviews on here. It was very run down, eerie corridors with no windows, musty and sometimes unpleasant smelling corridors. On the positive side our room was clean and had good air-con. In terms of location, it's really close to Bloor-Yorkville with the great shopping but it's nearly 15 blocks from the harbour and other trendy parts/tourist parts of town e.g. King street, hockey hall of fame etc. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: fab3c
Reviews.Content: Very nice and enjoyable! The hotel is centrally located and easy to find. Your got more than what you paid for which is not much for Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Classy!”
Reviews.Author: Gary R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sutton Place for a romantic weekend getaway during the Toronto Film Festival. The room was very bright, clean, and well appointed. The sitting area next to the window (sofa, wingback chair, coffee table) definitely contributed to the 'wow factor' when we opened the door. The view wasn't the greatest (12th floor, corner room) but when a room looks this good, who needs it? Definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but old”
Reviews.Author: SeesItAll
Reviews.Content: Ended up in the city during a convention but got a great rate. Hotel is not quite Yorkville and not downtown, while I was told it was a great location, it was kind of odd. Hotel is extremely old, but in decent shape. You can definitely see wear and tear on furniture. Had an upgraded room with kitchen which was useful. Tim Horton's across the street (gross) so I used Starbucks that's a block away. Yorkville is walkable but bout 10 minutes. Downtown is a healthy 30 minute walk. One block from the subway, which is easy to get about town. Hotel amenities I did not bother with because they were old and outdated: fitness center, "massage room", restaurant. Literally just used it to sleep. Staff was really friendly, helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, overrated and very eerie!!”
Reviews.Author: BelleDjour
Reviews.Content: Other than the location, which is quite but perfectly central downtown, It is an absolute dump!! We booked an "executive suite" at a rate of $420/night from Sat-Mon during TIFF week, the lobby is glamorous, and we expected the "executive rooms" to be as well, the pics on their site are soo misleading, our suite was on the 16th floor, as soon as we opened the door we were greeted by an awkwardly narrow hallway that was so claustrophobic which had a door to the right and a door at the end!! the door to the right lead into the "suite"...as soon as we walked in we got an eerie feeling accompanied by a smell of decomposition, old disgusting dilapidated carpet, decayed sofa, chairs...complete with peeling 70's (literally was there probably since then) and a repugnant painting. The seating area has a dark, dingy balcony which faced a creepy vast area of nothingness the only modern thing there was the flat screen tv. The bedroom was ok tho furniture was old it had a kind of a charm and a flat screen tv . Bathroom is so archaic, tiny. They also had one bathrobe when we ordered another we got attitude from the front desk staff and it never came!! Oh i almost forgot about the beyond creepy door at the end of the hallway outside the suite...I opened it and inside was another uglier door which probably was to another suite but the whole door inside of door concept was seriously very haunted house...creeeepy.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel - more than you are expecting!”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer176
Reviews.Content: SuttonPplace is perfectly located, Manulife is 2 blocks north with Cineplex VIP Theater, Bloor Street Diner, and tons of shops all along Bloor. The rooms are clean, bright and up to date. The lobby is elegant, check-in, check out is easy, and problems are resolved quickly. I have been at this hotel several times over the last year and will be staying here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, quiet despite the location.”
Reviews.Author: hrmelness
Reviews.Content: I stayed here March 8-9, 2011 for one night. The room was very spacious but the decor appeals to the grandmother set with the floral prints and antique brass trimmings. While I didn't feel that the building itself was dated, the "style" is definitely of a bygone era. If you're partial to more modern decor you'll feel that this hotel is old. The rack rates for this hotel is on the high side so I recommend using the online travel bidding sites to score a reasonable daily rate for this hotel. Despite being on busy Bay Street, the rooms are quiet, we had no problems sleeping. The location is conveniently downtown, good for TIFF.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value, very noisy though”
Reviews.Author: forsalebyandy
Reviews.Content: I pricelined this for around $160 for one night. It's about a 15 min walk to Eaton Centre and about a 10 min cab ride to the ballpark. For the price I got it for I would consider it a nice value. Anything else not so much. The room was nice sized, king bed. City view. Definitely an older hotel, walkable distance to most shopping and restaurants. You can, however, CLEARLY hear the traffic outside at all times and especially whatever is going on outside in the hallway. We had to endure HOUSEKEEPING all morning from them going to rooms around us. Also, very small bathrooms. Parking $25

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, comfortable, friendly staff...recommended”
Reviews.Author: infopro
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights over a weekend. The hotel was very quiet - we never heard anyone else in other rooms. Upon check in, was given a room next to the elevator - you can hear it and if you are a light sleeper ask to change rooms. I did, and was given a corner room that was very quiet and huge. The hotel's furnishings are not the super contemporary style that many TO hotels are now renovating to, but everything is of high quality, carpets and drapes seemed clean, and not a flowery bedspread in site. As we were travelling with a baby, we asked for a fridge, and one was delivered to the room within minutes of arrival. There's a convenient Tim Horton's right across the street for an early morning coffee. The pool is, as others mentioned, currently closed. Since we got an excellent rate on Priceline, we didn't mind.

Reviews.Title: “great service, great location, easy access”
Reviews.Author: beamylevi
Reviews.Content: This hotel has easy access from the street to your room and this part I just love. The front doorman no matter whom is working, is always helpful. The front staff are great also. This is my number one choice of hotels within the downtown core of Toronto or a nice walk to City Hall area or take in a hockey or Jays game.

Reviews.Title: “3 * like it”
Reviews.Author: tx_pearland
Reviews.Content: 2 adults + 8yr old stay there 3 nights ( 0807-0810) as our 2 wks summer vacation. Took Coach Canada from NF. Walked to hotel , not much pain. Room is nice size. Friendly front desk. Good location to bus\subway\eatery\shopping\grocery. Con: Hotel is kind of Old, Pool\GYM is out of service which was a big disappointment for my son and me.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: jazzy123Ottawa
Reviews.Content: This property is a good value providing you book as I did with priceline and bid $90.00.Stayed there twice this year same price . Dining room excellent for dinner.hotel located right downtown close to everything' best to use tim hortons across the street for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy stay - would go again”
Reviews.Author: LNMelon
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was neither friendly nor rude, but the concierge was very helpful and gave us some good breakfast recommendations. The room was clean and comfortable and had a little balcony, but no chairs (for the balcony or in the room), and the bathroom was quite small for 2 people's belongings but was manageable. Overall we were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly front desk, nice large and clean room...”
Reviews.Author: SalvadorSegovia
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by how nice and welcoming the receptionist was. Her name was Saudi and she was very cheerful and efficient. I was given room 1225 which was a large corner room. The bathroom had marble on the floor, sides, and ceiling. The room was nice and clean and the king-size bed was very comfortable. I visited some friends who were staying at the Metropolitan and their room was half the size.

Reviews.Title: “SNOOTY!”
Reviews.Author: Jenet D
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a great deal with its rating and all but, alas, I was wrong. The receptionist who checked us in, albeit professional, was as cold as the Ice Queen. When I walked into my bathroom, I found two soiled towels hanging behind the door and a partly-used soap and bottle of shampoo on the tub. The manager, who was a warm fellow, gave me a plate of fruit in return (one pear, orange, banana, a small bunch of grapes, a couple of strawberries, and two apples) . Oh, pray that it doesn't rain when you stay there because you'll get the nastiest look from the concierge if you ask to borrow an umbrella. My sister and I both did. The hotel is also slightly off the beaten path. We were not in the least bit impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, older hotel, could use a facelift”
Reviews.Author: eryneo
Reviews.Content: I purchased on hotwire which made it totally worth it. The room was HUGE but very old, and no ammentites. The TV in my room only worked sometimes. No free wifi, and the breakfast in the morning was quite lack luster. The fresh rose was a nice touch on the tray though. The note saying that the pool was closed "until further notice" was a bit of a downer since it's 30+ in Toronto in the summer. The hotel staff are a bit chatty.... with each other many times I was left frustrated waiting for my car from valet. Also they room keys got de-magnetized DAILY. this was something that the front desk told me they were fixing.... the day I left. Overall if you get this hotel on a deal site for a great price then it's TOTALLY worth it. I stayed there 3 nights and it was suitable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: BobM08
Reviews.Content: Well placed setting, near U of Toronto and downtown, with good and diverse restaurants and shopping places within walking distance. Staff were very friendly, from Toni the concierge (who was so helpful, friendly and professional), to the doormen, reception and cleaning folk. There was a laundromat around the corner that was able to wash all our clothes accumulated from earlier legs of our summer vacation for good value and quality. Rooms were big and functional, w/ wide screen TV. Downsides? Parking was expensive ($25/day). Doorways were thin and we were often woken by guests next door coming in late at night talking, knocking on doors, laughing. Interconnecting door let in music from next door too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: lloita99
Reviews.Content: I am a very picky when it comes to hotels choices. Never being to Toronto I was nervous when choosing Priceline and not having a choice in which hotel I would be chosen for me. When Sutton Place came up I was hoping I would not be disappointed because I was traveling with my girlfriend and she was depending on me to find a nice hotel at a reasonable price. Sutton Place was everything we were hoping it would be. Professional, clean, quiet, great location, nice restaurant . I would highly recommend Sutton Place and would definately stay here again.......4 stars for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: CubaFun123
Reviews.Content: I'm at the sutton place right now and I understand the last reviewers point. The pool is closed. I actually booked 3 days on price line and then called the hotel directly to book 3 days full price prior to my price line booking as I wanted a small summer vacation by a pool before my trade show started. Yes I was shocked to see the pool was under Reno. I talked to the gm who was very accommodating He just made my stay great....this is excellent management. Sorry to hear the previous reviewer didn't take the time to ask to speak to the gm. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. Sometimes when you bookon price line the a hotel will give you an older room....this is not the case here. You may get a room on a lower floor but they are very nice rooms. This hotel has an above average weight room wi modern equipment....comfy rooms....excellent location for one without a car as it's close to yonge street....no shortage of dining options from swarma to high end and everything in-between all within 2 to 20 minutes walking. I would stay here again for sure. My full priced reservation was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: tatacheri
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline for what seemed to be a good deal on priceline. I saw mixed reviews so I was optimistic but that did not last. PROS -great location- within walking distance or short cab ride to everything in dowtown TO, great shopping on yonge st. - hotel was kept clean CONS 1. I booked a standard room which in all my years of booking hotels has always meant double beds, I even called to confirm that months ahead. The room given to us had one king sized bed which I was told was an upgrade. There were 3 of us so the one bed was not adequate, when I called down to report the problem they told me that there were no more rooms available and that I could rent a stow away for $20/night....?????? took all afternoon and a lot of stress before they agreed to comp the stow away bed unti a room opened up the next day. 2. poor customer service- someone mentioned this on a previous review but I really believe that after they see that you booked through priceline they dont bother.. I've received better customer service at best western. 3. Pool was closed.. according to the letter on the desk it has been for 3 wks now.. not acceptable for a "4 star" hotel. 4. thermometer did not work, room was super hot.. had to call down so much, I didnt even bother calling about that. I WOULD NOT RETURN TO THIS PLACE SAVE YOURSELF THE TROUBLE AND PAY A LITTLE EXTRA FOR A NICER HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel”
Reviews.Author: liarav
Reviews.Content: Was there for 2 nights, great location and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Faded glory of a four star hotel that needs an upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: PhillyCityDweller
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place Hotel is centrally located near the Bloor Street shopping area, Yonge Street, and Church Street. In its heyday it was probably a four star hotel, but it has faded a bit. The hotel is very clean but the furniture in the lobby as well as in the room was older and needs updating. The bed in our room was way too soft and needed to be replaced. The room was very clean but there was no in room refrigerator. There was a large screen HD tv though. One really outstanding feature of the hotel was the maid service. Our room was cleaned quickly, promptly and efficiently during our stay. We went one morning across the street for a coffee when we returned the room was cleaned throughly. The indoor pool was closed for "emergency repairs" which was disappointing because it would have been nice to take a swim as relief from the heat. With some upgrading, the Sutton Place could return to its old glory as a true four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to all the bad reviews....”
Reviews.Author: beach712
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton Place Hotel for two nights, after booking a 4 star hotel on Priceline. We were expecting the worst after reading the reviews but were pleasantly surprised that the people at the front desk couldn't have been nicer. Check in was very easy and quick. The room was huge, clean and comfortable. The bed was firm but we like it that way. There was some noise from Bay Street but not a problem for sleeping. The bathroom was somewhat small for the size of the room but nice towels made up for it. The concierge's were extremely helpful in making recommendations for restaurants and tours. The location was perfect--one block from the subway and from a stop on Grayline Tour Bus. We would return there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: orleansontario
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay at this hotel. The location is ideal, the room is comfortable but could use a second chair. The Wi-Fi is pricey but this is the norm in these kinds of hotel. We got the room on a bid and it was certainly a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ireland090
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about staying in this hotel after reading very mixed reviews on it. However, I have to say that our visit was very pleasant. It is in a very good location within walking distance to the Eaton Cente (10/15 min) and around the city. There are also many taxis and cabs outside the door of the hotel. I was staying with a friend in a twin room - we are in our mid to late 20's and were looking for a good location and nice place to stay. It may be slightly old style in the corridors but the room was very nice, two big comfortable queen beds, lovely ensuite and it was very clean. We had use of the gym during our stay which was great, although the swimming pool isn't really good - if that's of importance to you. For us it didn't matter as we weren't using it. The man and lady at Concierge desk were very friendly, polite and very helpful. We hadn't been to Toronto before and they gave us very good information and were willing to help with any questions we had. There is a bakery, 'Tim Hortons', across the road for handy 'on the move' breakfast and there is also a 24 convenience store just down the street a little. Overall - a very clean and pleasant place to stay and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you are getting an amazing rate try to avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: funkycool
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked The Sutton Place hotel for a long weekend stay in Toronto through Expedia. The front desk staff on check in were bordering on rude when they saw the booking was through a website, in comparison to a couple who were checking in at the same time who booked through the hotel and got amazing service. We requested a quiet room on a high floor and were given the disabled room on the first floor above the meeting rooms. This room also backed onto the bank of five elevators which obviously ran all night. The decor is old fashioned and the rooms are dark but they are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Far cry from a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 3leafclover
