Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights for a romantic weekend. The room was spacious and clean but the air conditionning did not work so the room was always hot and stale. The hotel is in need of new decor as the look is very "grandma" style. The bathroom is small and the fan did not work so it made our room even more hot and humid. The pool was shut down for renovations. The satff were helpful and polite at all times. Parking costs 25$ a day and the food in the restaurant was good but somewhat pricey for what was offered. have stayed in nicer Best Westerns.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star... Not even close.”
Reviews.Author: Trupos
Reviews.Content: Got shafted by priceline by bidding on a 4 star, and were 'awarded' with a 3 star (by any reasonable standard). Carpets weren't vacuumed, small room with one queen size bed (which would've better served as a cement slab), and a view of what looks like a ghetto (on the backside of the hotel). This is the kind of place you settle for when all of the good accomodations are booked up. No fleabag joint, but a far cry from a 4 star hotel. Furthermore, I disliked the location (which is my own fault, because I targeted both north and south downtown Toronto on priceline). Years ago, I visited the area, and stayed at the Royal York which is a much nicer stay in a more desireable part of town. Do yourself a favor, and stay away from Sutton Place.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Cbass9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, we arrived early for check-in and had to wait an hour, after which we were upgraded to a deluxe King room, we had booked for $80 on priceline so that was a really nice surprise. The service was average and the rooms showed some serious signs of wear and tear. Location was good as the hotel was located near the subway and the university of Toronto. Overall pretty good probably a 3.5 star hotel rating would be accurate. High speed internet was annoyingly slow for the price and parking was reasonable for Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “loved it but wish we had been closer to rogers centre”
Reviews.Author: lovsons
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful but bed was only a double and location was too far for us from the rogers centre, train station and eaton centre. The room had a balcony which was unexpected and since we had great weather, that was a nice bonus. We had trouble ordering a movie but it was resolved within about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this tired old girl”
Reviews.Author: Bubbalink
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place in Toronto was probably once the glamour glitzy jewel of Toronto. One can see it was once very elegant with all the marble, granite and shiny polished brass. But now it has lost its glitter. The staff was inattentive, rude and really did not care about our needs. Food was insanely expensive. Room service was prompt, but the food was cold and tasteless. Do not tip the waiters, because it is already on your bill. The pool was by far one of the worst l've ever seen. Especially in a hotel like that. The gym was well equipped though and it had a very nice patio that no one seemed to use. Our room was very nice big and clean. But again, the bathroom was very small and dark and in desparate need of a make over. Look elsewhere if you want an elegant romantic weekend with your wife.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, helpful staff, would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: carolyn_bee
Reviews.Content: My seven year old daughter and I took a mini vacation to Toronto July 5-7 and we got our hotel on Priceline. I read the reviews here after being told we would be at the Sutton Place and I admit I was a bit worried. Turns out my worries were unfounded. We arrived two hours ahead of check in time but the front desk staff was quick and friendly in checking us in and directing us to our room. The room had a King bed and was a good sized room with a nice television and enough floor space for my daughter to spread out some toys. The bed was comfy and had plenty of pillows. The room was clean and we had no complaints. Both days I put the 'privacy please' sign on the door so we could sleep in and removed it when we left to go out. When we returned the room had been made up and we had no issues. There was a safe in the room and it was easy to use and again, no problems. I wandered down to the lobby and asked the first staff person I saw, who ended up being one of the doormen, for some directions to a few various places, estimates on how much taxi fare would be compared to how long to walk, etc. He knew all the answers, was friendly, chatted with my daughter about things she wanted to do etc. We ate dinner at the hotel restaurant one night, the food was good though I found the menu limited and would suggest to the management that they consider adding a childrens menu, even with just a few choices. The next evening we decided to just wander looking for a restaurant and we meandered down Bay Street to College and cut across toward Yonge Street, half way we found a little 60s diner looking spot called Frans restaurant and popped in there and it was fantastic! Great food, great prices and really friendly staff. Back at the hotel we decided a cooling swim was in order. We did find the pool a little difficult to find (why on earth is the door to get there marked 'gentlemen') but it took us only seconds to spot a staff member and ask for directions. Both visits to the pool we were the only people in there and my daughter had a blast. It isn't a very large pool but more than enough for what we needed and it was clean and well stocked with towels. All in all we had a great stay at a good price and I wouldn't hesitate to book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Leonol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights through Priceline. Although an older hotel, it was well kept and very clean. Furniture stylings in the room reminded more of stuff I'd see in my grandmother's house, but the furniture wasn't "outdated" by any means. It just wasn't the modern styling I'm used to seeing in other hotels. Nice flat screen TV in the room. Our room was large with two comfortable double beds. More than enough room for the beds, two night stands, a dresser, TV stand, desk, and small table with a chair. Our room on the third floor didn't have the greatest view, but did have decent sized balcony accessed by a door in the room. The AC unit worked without a problem. The bathroom was small but nice with shower/tub encased in marble tile. Rooms were quiet, I did not hear any noise from my neighbors or from the hallway at night. There was the standard small safe in the closet that was large enough for my ipad and other valuables. Housekeeping did a good job keeping the room clean on the days I requested service.. I didn't interact with the staff that much, but they did seem friendly when I checked in and checked out. Only a couple of minor complaints. Ice machine on our floor was broken and was never repaired during the stay. Not a big deal, but I had to make a trip up two flights to get ice. Although I never intended to swim while there, I did check out the pool and small doesn't even describe it. More of a wading pool. I can't comment on cost of parking as I kept my car at local friend's condo. I did not use the hotel's wifi so I can't comment on it's cost or effectiveness. I did not eat at the hotel as there were too many other choices in the city. It's location could not be beat, in the center of downtown. Walking distance to the Eaton Shopping Centre and close to rental bikes and subway. I would stay here again when traveling to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with character in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: karenk4662
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in March for a solo getaway and enjoyed it very much. The room had more character than a lot of downtown hotels. The lobbies were elegant yet relaxed. This is not a chrome and steel kind of place, but one with soft fabrics and muted colours. The very best thing was that you could walk everywhere from here. The hotel is very close to Church and Wellesley as well as to Queen Street and the subway system. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE.”
Reviews.Author: BabluK
Reviews.Content: Was planning to stay here but after speaking the manager who goes by the name of DENISE --, my outlook completely changed. I figured this would be a professional hotel and mature working environment but I was proven wrong. From the receptionist who picked up the phone call to talking straight with the manager, DENISE --, I realized that this hotel cannot even treat future customers well over the phone I cannot even imagine how they would behave in person. I highly recommend no one to even considering staying at this hotel where the manager itself cannot demonstrate customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Where do I begin?”
Reviews.Author: arif_a786
Reviews.Content: Started off by requesting an early check in because I was travelling for a full day to get there, only to have to wait for 6 hrs. I fell asleep in the lobby. First night, put DND on room, but received calls from front desk (for an incorrect parcel delivery), calls from housekeeping (even with privacy notice on door). Second night, false alarms went off and had to evacuate...after midnight...twice. Third night, group of 20 screaming kids in hallway for 2 hrs. Had to call front desk who said they'd send security. Alas, they never came... Quite possibly one of the worst hotel experiences I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: ShawEL
Reviews.Content: My main problem with The Sutton Place was that it was advertised as a 4 star hotel, which meant I was expecting a 4 star hotel. I would easily say that The Sutton Place is NOT 4 star. I am sure it was a really nice place 30 years ago, but the hotel was outdated and dingy. The air in my room did not cool and the hotel staff was either unable or unwilling to help. In order to get to the pool, you have to go through a maze like path underneath the hotel and the pool is small and smelly and a little scary. Also, they charge $16 a day for internet use, which is so confusing because I pay about $16 a month at home. The location was great and like I said, DO NOT EXPECT a 4 Star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in service and convenience .. will be back”
Reviews.Author: socareggae
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sutton Place in the past and have enjoyed the location and the service at the hotel. I am booked to say there again in July and I must compliment the Management for following up on a complainant I had voiced and assuring me that they will take care of my requests during this current stay. Travelling with my family â€“ my wife and daughter - this time made me somewhat apprehensive but I was determined to give it another try so I booked again at the Sutton Place which is so convenient to everything for us. One of the things that I am always impressed with at the Sutton Place is the excellent service. We are looking forward to our second trip to the â€˜Suttonâ€™.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.....Needs updates to become a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: randyprice12
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in great location for downtown Toronto, 5 minute walk to the subway station. I found the front desk great, friendly and help full, We had remote with dead batteries and they where quick to replace them. The beds where so comfortable, we loved the large tv in the room. We found the room comfy but the bathroom was very small, the exhaust fan didn't work. We did have fridge in the room but didn't work also. We had duvet on our beds but no covers for them. The halls ways had no a/c was a bit humid. The hotel was nice in lobby and customer service was great, we had found this one hotwire for $125 a night. We wanted 4 star, if we had payed there rate, the sutton place rate we would have been upset just based on how it marked as 4 star. It could be a 4 star with a few upgrades and little bit renovations. It is nice hotel don't get me wrong, we always like the fact that tim hortons was crossed the street and 24 hours convince and market with in 2 min walking distance. We wanted to drop our bags off and tour toronto around 10 am and guest services did check us in early with no extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but dated and poor sound proofing”
Reviews.Author: cblackst
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location but it is VERY dated and sound proofing between rooms is poor. You can easily overhear conversations in adjoining rooms even when people are using normal conversational voice tones. Service is good but not exceptional. This hotel is sometimes rated at four stars - I put it at three.

Reviews.Title: “Four star for two star prices”
Reviews.Author: konrad29
Reviews.Content: Very dated, but clean, spacious (we had a larger bathroom and balcony)....comfortable, two blocks away from gay area. The charge for wifi is really stupid. Used the gym twice, but limited equipment...would stay there again for the price we paid which was about $125 a night from hotwire

Reviews.Title: “Lacking customer service”
Reviews.Author: ErikaSteve
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights (5/12-5/14/11) and found that the rooms were small, but okay. I did call ahead and request 2 double beds vs. a Queen but they were unable to assist with my request, told there was nothing available. No, or very little, ventilation (fan) in the bathroom, so anytime we used the shower the mirrors and walls were dripping with water. The parking was extremely high priced per night and WiFi was expensive. In the US WiFi is generally free, even at McDonald's....so I find the price ridiculous. The worst by far was that there was an obvious wedding party above our room (on Sat. night). I called the front dest about 3:30am to say people were chanting out the balcony, screaming and jumping on floor above us. She said she'd send security up to deal with it. No change or resolution occurred. I called again about 4:10am and stated that I had a toddler (and us!) trying to sleep and that this was unacceptable. She said they'd look into it AGAIN. If they had been anywhere near that room or even on the lower balconies they could've clearly heard the noice....I recorded it on my cell phone video & THAT should tell you how loud this party was for well over 1.5 hrs. I said to her that perhaps the Toronto Police needed to look into this then, at which point she put me through to a manager. He was less than sincere, though he did say that they were sorry and would try to address the issue. Only then, did the noise stop. We were able to fall asleep about 4:45am. At check out we were not even asked how our stay was....so I assume that it was not a concern of the hotel's. Needless to say, we will not return. My parents stayed at the Hilton Downtown, had a room with FREE WiFi, cheaper parking and said they "slept like babies". We will heed their advice if we were ever to return.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we got this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: irish_blueeyes2001
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews my husband and I were slightly worried about what we would be walking into while staying at The Sutton Place Hotel after getting it on Priceline. Our room was stunning and the balcony just made it so much better! It was small-ish but it was perfect and who stays all day in the room anyway! Huge TV, lovely bedding and it was very neat and tidy! The lobby was stunning, the hotel is located a very short 2-5 min walk from the Wellesley Subway Station on the main Yonge Line. Although we didn't eat at the restaurants they smelled delish and the staff were very nice and got us checked in and out quickly and efficiently! I'm very glad that we got this hotel and would stay here again in a heartbeat! The price on the door said that we should be paying $465/night but we paid about $85+taxes! Love, love, love The Sutton!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old school hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: jenniferLAX
Reviews.Content: Comfortable beds... good locations, within walking distance to ROM and AGO (not a short walk but you can walk as I did). Room service food is not the best but the room was fabulous. Big rooms, nice lobby, 4 elevators so you don't wait long for one. We got a deal on priceline for about $150 which was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to initial expectations.”
Reviews.Author: conejotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at Sutton Place. The lobby is lovely, however, when we arrived there were 2 staff behind the counter and 2 in front of the counter with a police officer. I'm not sure why it took the attention of all 4 of them, one finally went around the counter to help us check in. The rooms are elegant, large, inviting, and clean. However, the internet, as has been mentioned, is very expensive and we couldn't get it to work. I called the number listed in the guest services guide, spent about 10 minutes on the phone with a tech who also couldn't figure out why we weren't getting service. He promised a return call with an answer, I waited about an hour, then called again to find they were no longer available (after hours). My husband was finally able to get on line later that evening, but the service was glacially slow. We were actually charged for the phone calls, they did take those charges off when we explained what they were for. The bathtub had a rubber stopper on a chain, when I tried to pull it out of the drain, it broke. One of the curtain poles was missing so we could only open the curtains on one side. I'm sure the management will respond to this with a nicely worded explanation, I wish they would put that kind of thought and effort in before the problems arise. It's so close to being a fabulous hotel, it seems it would take just a little more effort to get it there, I hope they'll decide it's worth the investment.

Reviews.Title: “Grandiose feel but wifi charges??!!”
Reviews.Author: Yackwanderer
Reviews.Content: The lobby is truly beautiful and 4 elevators made access so easy to our rooms. The rooms themselves are large and tasteful but the bathroom is very small with little space for toilet bags etc $18.50 per day for wifi access is just outrageous. Welcome to 2011 where all travelers, but especially business travelers, cannot be without connectivity in our rooms. I have not been charged for wifi in any other North American hotel. The Sutton Place is an expensive hotel so guests should not be expected to pay for a basic requisite when traveling. The concierge and room service staff were very accommodating, knowledgeable and professional.

Reviews.Title: “If it's not broken - then beware trying to fix it!”
Reviews.Author: jakeduncan
Reviews.Content: While I'm aware there is a wide choice of hotels in Toronto - to suit every pocket - and while my organisation is not driven solely by budget restraints, the Sutton Place has always been my first choice in the city. I'm in the concert touring business and have stayed in this hotel with several different artists (Paul Potts, Franz Ferdinand, The Cult etc). You would be surprised how some of the supposedly more notable big city hotels struggle to cope with the needs of a touring entourage, whose members - band and crew alike - spend anything up to 300 nights a year away from home: but, struggle those hotels do. "Master Room & Tax Account" would still appear to be a foreign language to many "cool" hotels. Frank Campo and Glenys Lacey, at the hotel, are well versed in the the simplicity of smooth check-in procedures for large groups, yet they still seem to find the time to deal with the detail surrounding individual guest requests. For my part, I recently spent four consecutive nights in Toronto there with the opera singer Paul Potts. With a Japanese tour imminent, my assistant and myself took it upon ourselves reorganise the layout of my already-spacious room, to resemble more of a production office: this didn't phase Frank whatsoever and Glenys even had the porter deliver another desk to the room, to assist with our workload. I'm quite a fan of the Sutton Place group, having spent time in both the Vancouver and Edmonton properties, down through the years. However, the Toronto location (within walking distance of many attractions and the city centre) remains my firm favourite. There's something of a "days gone by" feel about the hotel, harking back to an era of impeccable service and understated style. I'm looking forward to going back there soon! Jake Duncan

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for me!”
Reviews.Author: bexbees
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on March 18, 2011. We booked through their website and got an excellent deal of $120 for the night plus 1/2 price parking ($12) and a $50 credit for restaurant/room service. You can't beat that in Toronto. We used room service twice with the credit, both meals were fast and delicious, the waiter very courteous. We requested two champagne glasses for a bottle we had brought, delivered to the room without delay. We enjoyed the outdated, cottage-chic style of the hotel. We kept joking that we felt like we were staying at our rich grandmother's house :) It was very clean, bed was comfy, good flat screen, couldn't ask for more. The lobby was absolutely gorgeous. The bathroom phone was a hilarious novelty, obviously something that would have been the height of fashion when the hotel was built. I insisted on making all of my calls from it :) Great location. We were there for a concert at The Phonenix and it was just a short, cheap cab ride away. We ended up at the Mod Club after and that too was a reasonable cab fare away. It's right downtown and everything is easily accesible. We asked for a late check-out, was granted it no problem. I had a billing issue when I checked my credit card statement a few days later. One call to Andreas in finance and it was swifty and courteously corrected to my full satisfaction. I would definitely stay here again and fully recommended to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: AnonymusLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not perfect: it does need renovation (the bathrooms are really rather basic), the staff is ok (some very nice, some just average), and overall there were a few minor issues here and there. However, they have dealt with every question or request efficiently and graciously, the rooms are very spacious and overall comfortable, breakfast in the restaurant is good, and their pricing is just spot on. I wouldn't say this is a 5* hotel, but a solid 4*, and compared to other "fancy" 5* hotels in the city, which charge 30-40% more for a night, it comes out with flying colours. Don't expect perfection, but you will find a nice very decent hotel, with willing staff, clean spacious rooms and a comfortable atmosphere. I had a room with interconnecting doors to the adjacent one and was concerned about noise levels based on previous reviews. I had no issues at all. For the ladies: their bathroom amenities are basic, bring your own shampoo/conditioner. For the smokers out there: they still have a few nice smoking rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The Sutton Place is my home away from home"”
Reviews.Author: julia111Ottawa
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Sutton Place Hotel for ten years or so, some for or five times a year. I have nothing but praise for the management and the staff in this hotel. Everyone is courteous and helpful, from the front desk personnel to the doorman, to the hospitality crew, to the managers. The Accents Bar and Restaurant located on the first floor serves excellent food at competitive prices. I have stayed in a variety of rooms and if there was ever a problem I always brought it to the attention of the front desk or hospitality staff and it was dealt with immediately. I have never had a serious problem as everyone has always been responsive when I have asked for anything. There are many different kinds of rooms at this hotel, including suites. One need only specify what one wants upon reserving and the hotel staff will do their best to accommodate you, of that I am certain. The Sutton Place is very well located, across the street from the University of St Michael's College which is part of the University of Toronto, a few blocks from the ROM, the Ceramic museum, within walking distance of movie theaters, a subway and Yorkville. There are bus stops at the corner of Bay and Wellesley, just steps from the entrance to the hotel. For anyone who enjoys being in the thick of it and yet requiring quiet and comfortable surroundings, the Sutton Place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Warning about unauthorized room access”
Reviews.Author: jason_riley
Reviews.Content: I am a travel writer/photographer who has stayed at hundreds of hotels around the world. None are perfect but in all my years of reviewing hotels I have never endured what I did at the Sutton Place. Let's start with a minor issue that I was originally willing to overlook. I booked a room for $120 and paid an additional $44.25 for the hotel's "early-in, late-out" package, which claims to allow guests to check-in as early as 11am and check-out as late as 2pm. I showed up at 12:30 pm and was told my room wasn't ready. So much for the early check-in that I paid for. Luckily I only had to wait about 10 minutes for a room to be ready...but I couldn't help but wonder what would have happened if I had tried to check-in at 11am. Upon getting into my room I immediately placed the 'Do Not Disturb' card on the door handle. I did some photography of the room for my article using the natural light and made some notes about the room and its amenities. I locked my camera gear in the safe, put one of my bags in the closet and left the camera tripod in the corner of the room. I left the room (with the 'Do Not Disturb' card on the door handle) and proceeded to another hotel that I was assigned to review. I did not sleep at the Sutton Place. The next morning I returned to the Sutton Place and discovered that my key-card didn't work. I noticed that the 'Do Not Disturb' sign was gone. Concerned, I returned to the front desk and -- in a show of poor customer service -- was blamed for the card not working. "You must have had it close to your credit cards or cell phone," the clerk said. I returned to the room and entered. My bill, which had been slipped under the door overnight, was on the floor. The room had been inexplicably tidied-up (even though I had left the 'Do Not Disturb' sign on the handle) and -- to my horror -- my bag and tripod were gone. Luckily the camera gear that I left in the safe was still there. I called the front desk and a manager called me back quickly. I demanded the return of my belongings and an explanation of why someone ignored the 'Do Not Disturb' sign and entered my room at some point in the night. He promised to investigate and knocked on my door within a few minutes holding my bag and the tripod -- which he said he recovered from housekeeping. He couldn't explain why my belongings had been removed even though the 'Do Not Disturb' sign had been on the door and the room belonged to me until at least 2pm. I was livid. He offered to comp the room (which is literally the very least he could do under the circumstances) and said he would do an audit to find out who made the unauthorized entry into my room and decided to clear it out of my property. Had the camera been missing from the safe I would have called the police. There is no excuse for what happened. The Sutton Place gets a failing grade. If you choose to stay there, be VERY careful what you leave in the room when you're not there because it could be gone when you return and be aware that DO NOT DISTURB means nothing to the staff, apparently.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Zeus007
Reviews.Content: The room was large and the king bed very confortable. However, doors opening and closing in the corridor were noisy. The room was well-decorated with ornate design. Bathroom was clean but toilet paper almost inaccessible, under the sink.

Reviews.Title: “Thin wall”
Reviews.Author: Mylene-on-the-go
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Sutton Place Hotel was not good. I have categorize it in two: not acceptable and could of been better. Not acceptable: The wall are so thin I was able to follow my next door neighbor phone conversation... At 11:45 PM! No more hot water in the shower at 7:30 am. Could of been better: Very tiny gym with not much. I'm very disapointed at this hotel. I was told it was once very popular.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Calisto4444
Reviews.Content: I always stay here when I'm in Toronto for work. The friendly staff and great rooms are always a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Best value”
Reviews.Author: MrWonderfulToronto
Reviews.Content: There are better hotels but this one has price and location. Also where are you going to find a full suite for $250 or so in this area. I know it needs renovations but I hope they don't because I don't want the price to rise.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Soulee123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful time. The room was large and the mattress was one of best that I have slept in, in a long time. Breakfast was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality, and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: speedingkoala
Reviews.Content: During the renovation of my house I stayed a few nights at the Sutton Place in a Studio apartment. It was just great. I pass by the hotel every day on my way to work, so it seemed a good choice to try the hotel for those nights. The staff was very friendly, and they seemed very professionel. I have not used their restaurant, but one of the guys let me check-out the rooftop club. It was a very good experience. I can imagine having a birthday party up there. It looks over downtown Toronto, and the view is just breathtaking. I would really recommend everyone to stay and spend a few nights there.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Toronto, a great city”
Reviews.Author: BunclodySenator
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Sutton Place Hotel many times in the last 3 years, but this was one of the best. My suite was beautiful, the hotel is well kept up, the food is great, and the staff are superlative. From check-in, after Harvey or Izzie or Nuno or the other friendly welcoming gentlemen have taken the luggage, through the maid service, laundry, room service and restaurant, the treatment is first class. I like a suite on a low floor, which enables me to use the stairs as part of my exercise regimen. The check-in staff were very accommodating. I always request a small empty refrigerator, to assist me in my need to have numerous small snacks and meals (I'm diabetic), and again, not a problem. I had some dietary restrictions while dining in the restaurant, being Jewish, and again there was no problem. Everything was always handled with the attitude that no request was too much for the staff. I will continue to stay at the Sutton Place whenever I'm in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Should have booked another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mlsa913
Reviews.Content: I booked this on hotwire - and as you know, you do not know what hotel you get until after you booked. This was shown as a 4 or 4.5 star hotel. I then went on trip advisor and read a number of reviews that made me start regretting my decision to go through hotwire. We booked a queen sized room and didn't realize how small the bed actually was, so we called down to change our room and upgrade to a king size room. They told me that was possible, but it was a $40 upgrade fee. I agreed because not only the bed was small, but the room was rather tiny too. All of the other reviews mentioned how outdated the rooms are - which they were. The rooms were tidy, clean and the bed was comfortable, but the furnishings and phones were very out dated. You can tell this was an extremely nice hotel at one point in time, but is in need of an update badly. Everything about our trip was just "ok", it didn't knock my socks off, but it was nothing to complain about - until late at night. We attended a concert and came back to the room a little late and wanted to have a drink in the room out on the balcony and enjoy the city lights. We ordered a bottle of wine and some some beer. Not a few minutes after did I hear someone at the door - thinking that was way to fast for room service - but didn't think much of it - UNTIL SOMEONE WALKED RIGHT INTO OUR ROOM. The hotel staff gave keys to our room out at 1:30am. As you can imagine, both parties was confused and annoyed - so I called down to the front desk. WHen I spoke to the manager - I was told "it was just a mistake and they were sorry". Well, after reading a number of other complaints on the website about things gone wrong and no consideration/compensation or anything else accept for an apology was given - I was a little annoyed. I asked the manager specfically if they were planning on doing anything - and he said well hotwire already paid for your room, so I can't refund anything. I said no "i paid for my room", but it was purchased through hotwire. He again told me he couldn't do anything. It was only after I was angry on the phone did he agree to comp my room service charge that we just ordered along with the upgrade AND our breakfast charge. After that was agreed upon, I received a phone call telling me they could not comp the wine per Senior Management. First nothing was offered - then what was offered was being taken back. Needless to say, I was even more annoyed, frustrated and angry. After another heated conversation with the manager, he told me not to worry and the charges would be reversed. I was not looking for a handout - but having someone walk into your room at 1:30am was not acceptable - but not evening being offered anything after that happened was simply wrong. Sutton Place - problems happen, mistakes are made - but it is how you respond to those that makes you a shining star. Apparently, from other reviews and my own experience - you have a lot to learn in the art of Customer Service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Maggie182145
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. The location is excellent and staff were all very friendly. Le Grand Residence has all the amenities you could ask for and was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Tonyswife49
Reviews.Content: OK..so, I've known the Sutton Place in Toronto my whole life....parents showed our dog in 1970 there, inbetween houses in 1992 mom and dad rented one of their residential apartments. Stayed here in 2007, was less than impressed with the decor, service, etc...apparently, quality of stay changed a few years back after hotel changed hands to foreign investors....now, I decided to take a chance again, and am very pleasantly surprised...since 2007 stay, quality of rooms has improved, decor has been cleaned up and the hotel is busy again. I would highly recommend this hotel to travellers..the location is great, the cleanliness is great, and the room service was very nice. I found the front desk hotel staff to be a little arrogant and less welcoming than the Four Seasons up the road, but am not going to judge the hotel based on them.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Randall H
Reviews.Content: I bought this room through Priceline.com, and I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews. My fears were unfounded: service was friendly, very clean, and most importantly, the bed was very, very comfy. I was in town to attend the wedding of my middle brother's daughter!! Imagine how happy I was to find out that my brother was a guest, too and it was not planned!! We definitely had angels at work here! The wedding was fabulous, the reunion, with my family was terrific, & what little sleep i got was the tops! Highly recommend. How can you hate it? Ten minutes to town, the Subway around the corner, and a Tim's across the street!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Again With So Many Hotel Options in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Divasmother
Reviews.Content: My husband and I do a lot of traveling, so feel that our reviews are qualified from the number of hotels that we have experienced. Sutton Place was convenient to restaurants and shopping, however, it had lots to live up to with the lack of quality of services. Firstly, the restaurant downstairs was ok for breakfast but choose to go somewhere else for dinner, there are lots of wonderful restaurants in the area. We dined one evening in the hotel restaurant. I have never before sent a meal back, this was the first for me. The waiter came back with it telling me that what I got was all they could do for me. The salmon that I ordered was so over cooked it was like cutting through sandpaper. I told them to keep it. I went without. I wanted to work out in the gym. What is indicated on the elevator is actually one floor off of where it is located. I finally found the correct floor but there was nothing to indicate where the gym was located. A maintanence worker came by and asked if he could help me. He told me to follow him....down the hall, around the corner to a door that had a sign on the wall "Men". I thought he was taking me into a bathroom, only to find that it actually led to a hallway, turning the corner was the gym. Why it had a sign "Men" is beyond me when it should have read "Gym" The gym was a disappointment.....I guess my workout was in finding it! Water. I could not find a bottled water to purchase in the hotel. I went to the front desk to ask where I could find a vending machine. I was told that if I wanted bottled water I had to go out of the hotel, walk up the street to a deli to purchase a bottle of water...the hotel shop was not yet open. Every hotel that we have stayed have water bottles provided in the room.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: morralkan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sutton Place hotel a few days ago. I had a corner room, so I had light from large windows on two sides of the room. The room was very large with a great, comfortable king size bed. The room, as well as the hotel in general, was very clean and well-decorated in a traditional style. The only minor complaint was that the bathroom was a little tight, but easily usable. The hotel was quite quiet. I didn't eat in the hotel restaurant, but I found the housekeeping and front desk personnel very pleasant. If I were returning to Toronto, I would not hesitate to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Disgruntled62
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place is a hidden treasure. I booked us a room for two nights over Thanksgiving and it was such an excellent deal. The Elegant Package was worth every penny. Breakfast was very good and self-parking was included in the rate. We have family in Toronto and we found the location very convenient as well.

Reviews.Title: “Like Staying with Friends”
Reviews.Author: DAshtonWagner
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy my visits back to the Sutton Place. The hotel is not the most luxurious and it doesn't have the latest snazzy dÃ©cor or amenities. But many of the staff have been there for a long time. It's like staying with friends. I enjoyed seeing Jennifer at the Concierge Desk, Israel in Accents Restaurant, and Peter in the Business Centre. How could I forget Izzy (doorman) and Harvey (bellman)? The hotel is centrally located -- an easy walk to Yorkville or Queen's Park, one block from the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Solid traditional hotel”
Reviews.Author: YorksUK
Reviews.Content: The Hotel dÃ©cor is a little dated - but in a nice way! Our room was rather small (perhaps due to a Priceline booking) but perfectly adequate. Room amenities were good and the bed very comfortable. Concierge very helpful. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs.... poor response”
Reviews.Author: rathernoname
Reviews.Content: Wife woke up with bed bug bites, notified Hotel immediately, they advised us that room would be changed and all of our clothes would be dry cleaned... staff inspected and said, inspection was INCONCLUSIVE ...we changed rooms and left all clothes in plastic bags in room... met with assistant manager on Monday, he said clothes would be dry cleaned, but said he needed official inspector to come... never got back to us with an answer of when our clothes would be cleaned, never admitted anything, never apologized for any inconvenience, never offered any kind of compensation, nor advice on what to do when we returned home... polite but did nothing. Took them 30 hours to verify the presence of the nasty critters, Our clothes were picked up some time on Monday afternoon and returned at 5:30 AM on Tuesday, and our original room was fumigated that evening causing our traveling companions in an adjoinging rooms to chage rooms. We checked out Tuesday and returned home to Chicago, taking every possible precaution we could find to not contaminate our home.. We understand the problems of prevention hotels confront... we do not understand their lack of quick, efficient and courteous response to a problem that was very evident they frequently encounter.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure... mostly”
Reviews.Author: CatnipThieves
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sutton Place for the 2010 Toronto Film Festival. We were originally booked into one of the self-catering apartments, but upon arrival we were told it wasn't available. Instead, we were upgraded to one of their executive suites - and it didn't disappoint. Two bathrooms, a separate lounge, walk-in closets and two HDTVs with a multitude of channels. We were also provided with a small fridge. The suite itself was lovely, and the staff were courteous and helpful with all queries. The only real downside was the woeful wireless internet connection, which cost around $50 for a week. The hotel is situated in an uptown location within easy reach of all Toronto's sights (we didn't use the subway or bus network at all, apart from to / from the airport), and the concierge was always on hand to provide handy hints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: buttercup40
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find, plentiful parking, when we entered the hotel the bellman was there to assist us. The front desk was quick and efficient. We had been upgraded to suite, which was a pleasant surprise and it was very spacious with a living room and bedroom. Although we did not have time to use the facilities they looked very nice - a gym and a pool. Breakfast the next morning was good, not rushed the way some places can be. Overall a great stay and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here- rip off”
Reviews.Author: atschick
Reviews.Content: Pro's - Location is good, Conceirge desk was friendly Con's - Internet is 16 per day or 5 dollars for 15 minutes, parking is 25 per day, front desk staff is not friendly, room is nothing special. Don't expect anything extra at this hotel besides the bare minimum. 2nd day, water pressure dropped suddenly and water was brown.

Reviews.Title: “Scary, ugly”
Reviews.Author: SixStarQueen
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 bedroom suite but upon arrival they very cheerfully announced they had upgraded us to the penthouse, I was pleasantly surprised but was wary at the same time. My daughter eagerly opened the door to the room and stepped back as the door opened into a dark void. This was the first time I have ever checked into a hotel room where not a single a light was on! Most unwelcoming feeling indeed! As soon as we found the light switch we were almost tempted to turn it off again. The room was the epitome of ugly. The website shows a well lit, handsomely furnished suite with dark gleaming paneling on the walls, sparkling chandelier, warm study... the reality was far from comforting. The room had an air of disuse, we turned on all the lights but could not dispel that dark, uncomfortable feeling. I rang down and asked to be moved immediately only to be told the 2 bedroom apartment I requested was not available until the next day. The kitchen tap water ran brown, the tap in the ensuite was broken. The water stopped altogether for a few minutes while I was in the shower the following morning! We could clearly hear the wedding party upstairs as the music thumped along and the party MC. The view would have been spectacular but they put cheap UV film over the windows that made the view blurry. I pulled up the window shades only to have the part of the window frame fall towards me! We did move to a 2 bedroom apartment the following morning but that was no better. Sutton Place Hotel - NO THANK YOU, not EVER again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but a little old and a little stuffy”
Reviews.Author: RockyMom2010
Reviews.Content: To describe this hotel the word "grand" would probably summarize it best. Marble walls and floors, chandaliers and winged chairs. The location is great - close to small grocery stores, restaurants, coffee shops and stores galore. The room we ended getting upgraded to was huge and had a great view. The only things that didn't go so well were these: - our first room was too far from the wireless router so we couldn't get internet - in our first room the TV remote wouldn't work so when we called to ask for a new remote or batteries, their only solution was to upgrade us--which worked out ok because the upgraded room was lovely (see our pictures) but we did have to pack up all our stuff and move ourselves up one floor. The bellman just gave us the key and didn't stick around to help us. Lastly, I think this hotel has great respect and tradition from the older age group (age 65+). So when we entered the lobby in our shorts and t-shirts, sweating after a long walk around the summer streets of Toronto, we'd be faced with older men in suits and older ladies dressed in their best, looking at us like we didn't quite belong. But don't let my "bad" points influence you. This was a lovely and comfortable hotel (which by the way we got for $130/night on Hotwire.com) I think the rooms are usually much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Comments on trip advisor don't do it justice. great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: RHAssoc
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about boking this hotel with only this site to advise me. Many other hotels were fully booked as we booked very late and I was concerend why they had place. I guess the reason is that it;s not in the centre. However it is walkable to the CN tower with lots to view on the way. The rooms were great lots of space and contrary to a comment saying it was tired I think it was very nicely decorated with nice period furniture. Staff were very friendly and helpful. I thought the breaksfast was expensive but I am sure no mre than other comparable Hotels. If your looking for a smart looking hotel at the right price then this it. Book it.

Reviews.Title: “great place near younge street”
Reviews.Author: windowrun
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of my favorites in toronto.Employees are more then willing to help.Rooms are always clean and good size for t.o.The location is one block from younge street so no need for a car.

Reviews.Title: “A good location for the non-jet set”
Reviews.Author: CodgersontheMove
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, located about one mile from the harbor and almost directly across the street from the University of Toronto. The room was spacious; the beds were comfortable; and the staff was friendly enough. For those travelers wanting to be closer to the action, this may not be the right choice for you, although it is a short walk to the subway station, which runs north-south, with east-west connections not far away. All in all, it was a very good location for us.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel itself is fine, but some of the service was a bit lacking”
Reviews.Author: echoesofsummer
Reviews.Content: Sutton Place is a perfectly nice hotel, with big rooms and well equiped. However, the front desk seemed to be under staffed (a long wait on check in) and they weren't always responsive to our requests. The room keys deactivated themselves twice during our stay. We also found we had quite a bit of noise from the lifts, and perhaps because we were near the lift shafts, the wifi internet didn't work in the room. The breakfasts in the restaurant are very good....we tried a range of dishes and they were all great - pancakes especially. If you have 30 dollars credit included in your room price though you will struggle to stay within this for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Old, Outdated Hotel with Obnoxious Employees”
Reviews.Author: newtorontonian
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sutton Place in August in an Executive Suite for 5 nights. The front desk staff were incredibly rude and some had limited English skills. The doormen were the only staff that were pleasant and would go the extra mile for the guests. The housekeepers would ignore the "Privacy Please" sign on my door and would wake me up every morning at 9am so they could clean. Not only did they make me feel uncomfortable, but thy never cleaned the room very well, there was dust on the curtains, I found black stains on my duvet, and I even found notes left by previous guests next to the night stand. The bedroom and the parlor room was spacious, but the decor was worn. The white furniture had scuff marks on them and the former wet-bar (no longer stocked) underneath the T.V. in the Bedroom had weird brown-goopy stuff in it. The staff "solved" the problem by just locking the cabinet. The phone in the bedroom didn't work, I called the front desk and nothing was done about it. The room had two bathrooms that were small. If they ever renovate this hotel, they need to just make one killer bathroom in their suites. I think it's gross when the shower curtain touches the toilet and when there is little counter space. I also believe it's not a coincidence that they never show pictures of their bathrooms on websites. I think mini fridges definitely need to be added, especially when other hotels in the area such as Windsor Arms, the Intercontinental Yorkville, and the Cosmopolitan include them in all rooms. The HD TV's had remotes that never functioned properly, and it was a pain to change channels. The pool was gross, it had scum around the edges. There wasn't any lights in the pool either. The sliding doors in the pool area that lead out to the balcony/terrace was very cool though. The women's sauna was broken. Room service was overrated. The fruit always looked bad, the eggs Benedict was just average. A litre bottle of water was $7 CAD with a $2 delivery charge and 15% service charge. God forbid you went out and brought back take out food or a bottle of wine, they would charge you to use their silver ware or glasses. This annoyed me so much I just used plastic cups in the bathroom for my MoÃ«t and bought plastic wear at Rabba's grocery a block away. I would only consider staying there again if they renovated ALL the rooms. Not just those penthouse suites that most people never stay in.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel EVER....”
Reviews.Author: SiobK
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sutton Place last July while visiting family- the hotel looked nice on the internet but we had no idea how nice it actually was going to be. The rooms are so comfortable, the layout, the style, the interior- i couldnt put to words how impressive the hotel was. Everything including massages are completely arranged for you, all you need to do is mention the word to the polite and friendly staff and next you now it is completely done for you. In all the hotels i have ever stayed in, i have never seen staff so friendly, accomodating and polite- they cannot help you enough and really make a holiday a proper holiday!! Gym and pool is fabulous and the beds are divine...just what you need after a long day sightseeing and travelling...the beds are THE most comfortable beds in the world. All in all i cannot commend this hotel enough- it was beyond any 5 star standards i have ever seen. I have not stopped recommending the hotel for its endless benefits to friends and family since i stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Glory / But Good value”
Reviews.Author: planningpro
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is no longer in its prime, it was a good value for our 6 night stay. It has the amenities of a 4-star hotel such as a good concierge, 24 hr. room service,etc, but the trappings are dated. The bed linens and towels are only 3-star quality, there is no a/c in the hallways, so it was musty in the summer. The furniture in the room was both dated and a little worn. Nevertheless, the service was excellent and the staff friendly and accomodating. We received a 35% room discount and $25 food credit for our length of stay and were upgraded to a suite on checkin w/o even asking. So, because none of the other hotels in this class stood out, we took the best deal. The location is a brief walk from the Yorkville district which has plenty of good restaurants. All in all, it was quite enjoyable. So long as your expectations are realistic, this can be a very nice place to stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than expected”
Reviews.Author: Blueskynet
Reviews.Content: Most travel booking sites rate this hotel as a 4 star hotel, but it's really just a 2 star hotel with valet parking and bellman services. The bellman was friendly and that was pretty much the only good thing about this hotel. The room we got is one of those which faces a building (closely right in front of the room) and that blocks out most of the view and natural light, so the room felt very small and cramped. Plus all the furnitures as well as the bathroom are all old and pretty worn-out. It just felt like we were in a motel room. The location is okay as the hotel is close to a subway station, and there are some restaurants and convenience stores nearby. I guess if we had an expectation that this was going to be a 2 star hotel going in, then I might have given it a higher score.

Reviews.Title: “very noisy room next to elevators”
Reviews.Author: citycat-713
Reviews.Content: My family were at Toronto for Rogers Cup. We stayed at Sutton Place for 3 nights. I booked a room with 2 double beds because we have a 16 year old son. We were placed in room 412. The room was next to the elevator which we could hear lound noises each time it passed by. We thought it would stop later at night, but it didn't, it kept going all night long and the frequency was unbearable. I could not sleep well all night. Early in the morning next day, I complain to the front desk, I was told my only choice was to a smoking room. I then spoke to a manager. I was offered an "upgrade" to a suit with only 1 queen bed. My 6' son had to sleep in a roll away bed which was too short and unconfortable. The roll away bed was left against wall when we were out. There was no set up, no blanket. The very reason I choose Sutton Place was because it had an option of 2 beds. Needless to say, I was very disappointed. I am sure I am not the only person complained about this problem. The front desk did not offer any apology with the attitude of "there is nothing we can do". I think someone from the management should spend a night in a room next to the elevator to fully understand the situition. These rooms are so noisy, it should not qualified as a regular room and it should not assign to guests without any disclosure of the condition. The most important thing for a travelor is to have a good night sleep, Apparently, this is too much to ask for at Sutton Place.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say except this hotel is a...”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller30
Reviews.Content: What can I say except this hotel is a basic three star. Way past it's prime. Clunky and often broken or worn-out furniture in the rooms, snarly front desk staff (two in particular come to mind), extremely slow TVs that don't respond to the remote control in less you are standing in front of the Telly, slow Internet, dingy hallways, restaurants continental "included with the room breakfast" consists of tiny muffins and sorry looking fruit, curtains are threadbare, walls are thin, and the business centre is just depressing. I can't understand how this hotel qualifies itself as a four star because it is at best a mediocre three. Pay the difference and go to the Hilton, the Westin, the Four Seasons... Heck go to a Hilton Homewood Suites... This place is long past its prime and it shows -- management's protestations on here to the contrary. I have stayed here frequently for business and can attest that there are better hotels here. Not that this place doesn't have potential -- modernize the rooms, give the hallways a face lift, redesign the business centre and this place would be a lot better. As it is it merits a weak 3.

Reviews.Title: “good location, decent value”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCatLady
Reviews.Content: Well located on Bay St. near Bloor, the Sutton Place offers a decent value in Toronto. Although the rooms are furnished in an outdated, fake antique style, mine was large and the bed was comfortable. I was given a room that connected to the next room, something that can add to noise issues. Luckily, nobody noisy stayed next door. The air conditioning had a good fan that allowed white noise which also helped. Bathrooms are small but adequate. The hotel is quite clean. Breakfasts were good and staff were in general very helpful and pleasant. I got a room rate that, for Toronto, was a good deal. Being able to walk to Bloor and the R.O.M. is a useful convenience too. A person could do a lot worse for more money!

Reviews.Title: “Top-Notch Hotel Within Walking Distance To Toronto's Major Attractions”
Reviews.Author: joelruthd
Reviews.Content: Friendly, informed service from entire staff--front desk and concierage particularly helpful. Corner room (501) particularly pleasant--particularly welcome were windows that could actually open a little so we could get fresh air if we didn't want ac on. Location couldn't be beat. We are walkers and the location, about half-way between CN Tower and Kensington Market, was ideal, and probably was what we liked best among the hotel's many good features. What we liked least was the fact that safety deposit box in room wasn't working (we were told that none of the boxes in the hotel were operative) and there was no indicatiion when it would be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lghmardo
Reviews.Content: We are seniors and just returned after spending four nights , Jul 22-26 , at this wonderful hotel. We were in room #718 and it was very large and very comfortable with two beds. Spotlessly clean. The shower was awsome. No "Lo-Flo" shower head here. My husband said this was the best shower that he has had in a hotel or cruise ship. (We travel a lot.) Everything was so efficient right down to the house keeping staff. We would come back from breakfast and our room was already done up. The location is very good for getting around, the subway is very close and walking distance to so many attractions, shopping etc. The restaurant was very convienent for breakfast although very pricy. We signed up for the "Sutton Privilege Program" before we made reservations and were given a $30.00 a day room credit for the restaurant and free WIFI which was a great value . We are already planning another trip to Toronto to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel has everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: maryandluc
Reviews.Content: My partner and I chose to stay at the Sutton Place due to its location close to the ROM, shopping, university campus and fabulous restaurants. It is located on the subway line, so visiting family and friends was very accessible. Our stay at the Sutton was pleasantâ€”offering large, comfortable and clean rooms with great beds!! The staff was extremely friendly and seemed to personally acknowledge each client. The hotel has a great bar for cocktails as well. The only downfall to the stay was having to pay extra for internet. I would definitely recommend this hotel to those young and old who want to experience Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and traditional”
Reviews.Author: susanjon
Reviews.Content: I choose to stay @ the Sutton Place Toronto on business several times a year. I like the location--- it's a short walk north to Yorkville, and a quick taxi ride to the downtown core...unlike other downtown properties, one can also self-park easily (rather than waiting for valet). The traditional lobby beats any modern hotel, the service is good and the rooms spacious with old world character and modern amenities.... I also occassionally entertain customers in the bar off the lobby where the service is attentive. I much prefer this hotel to a highrise boxy modern one with 500+ tiny rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: kerrjn
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked a twin room non smoking. We were given a double smoking told take it or leave it. The room smell was revolting. As my sister was in Canada for the breast cancer survivors Dragon boat races we found this hard to accept. The receptionist didnt even give us a choice. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone and as we had just arrived from a long trip from Brisbane Australia did not have the energy to argue.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated hotel in disrepair; management loves to argue with guests.”
Reviews.Author: crossrock
Reviews.Content: Sutton Place issues, if you can believe it! -Fire alarm evacuations due to management incompetence. -All elevators shut down twice today due to power failure. -No hot water on several occasions (no warning). -No water at all for one hour (no warning). -Front desk couldn't receive fax due to "no toner left" -Front desk couldn't send fax due to "stuck in memory" -Internet stopped working for several days due to an "upgrade" -Door keys stop working every few days for no apparent reason. -Business center closes at 4:30PM (and the guy leaves even earlier some days) The list goes on and on. This hotel's completely incompetent, and management gives you a blank stare whenever there's an issue. Better yet, they LOVE to argue with guests, trying to convince them that they should "expect" such problems in an older hotel. The best part of this hotel is the valets. They are very friendly, produce a valet car within minutes and run an efficient operation. Otherwise, the place is a disaster. Bottom line: go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Old-style comfort”
Reviews.Author: P_Stibbons
Reviews.Content: I had to be in Toronto for a week, and this time stayed at the Sutton - the dÃ©cor is understated, but the rooms were spacious, comfortable, clean and everything works. There's easy access to business, shopping and sights. In terms of quibbles, while the food is good, the restaurant menu is restricted. There is a pool, but neither the size, shape or depth for actual swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: calgirl1603
Reviews.Content: Does not worth the money, very overpriced...bad location, walls are paper thin, front desk staff rude, bed was very uncomfortable...very long walk to all city attractions

Reviews.Title: “Needs more smiles!!”
Reviews.Author: MantaEngland
Reviews.Content: As far as the rooms go they were pretty good. There was plenty of space with two beds in the room. I think it i usually rated as 4* and the only reason stopping this being higher based on the standard of rooms, reception decor etc is the finishing, it just needs a few areas touching up and it would be trully lovely. However I found it very rare to get a smile out of the staff. To be fair when I submitted questions in advance regarding a visit to Niagara the response was speedy and efficient and all my requests were met. I just found it very unfriendly and would more than likely look for somewhere else to stay if I was to visit Toronto again. According to the wall in the bar many a famous face has visited but I personally do not see that as any reason for what appeared at times to be downright ignorance and impudence. As far as I'm concerned all area's in the service industry should provide service with a smile to all customers. Also the room service was very expensive. On our first night we arrived after a long day around 10.30 in the evening and being so late ordered room service. Foe a plate of Nacho's, 2 beers and a juice it cost us $50. Canada is not exactly a cheap country but at the end of the day it was a plate of nacho's and a couple of beers, this is extortionate!!

Reviews.Title: “June trip with tenage daughter”
Reviews.Author: Twogirls_7
Reviews.Content: Toronto is great place to visit, vibrant and friendly, definitely recommend it, Sutton Place is well located and great hotel. Staff friendly and helpful - especially the concierge. Room large and very cean - only problem we had was a self flushing toilet that kept me awake at night but staff were very nice when i told then about it. We did not get around to using health club or restaurant as we were too busy trying to fit everything in.

Reviews.Title: “Average service and dated - very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: acculligan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sutton place after booking it via Hotwire. I had big expectations as the Sutton PLace in Vancouver is incredible. From the minute I walked in the door where they watched me struggle with my bags through the doors, to the huff when I requested a map, to the morning I had to ask the local housekeeping staff to take their argument elsewhere I found the service in this hotel to be terrible. One morning the housekeeping staff barged in at 7:45am loudly asking when I wanted room service. I found at this stage I ended up putting a privacy note on my door for the duration of my stay. The lights in the bathroom were out, and the heating doesn't work. Not to mention, If you have a MAC laptop, the internet access is a MISSION! I will not stay here again and very disappointed .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but shame about some things . . .”
Reviews.Author: Niawynp
Reviews.Content: Good things: Clean hotel, big rooms, a lovely swimming pool and terrace (great to relax in on a hot day), reasonably good location (very close to the subway and Queens Park), doormen and cleaners were fantastic, nice restaurants very close to the hotel, lovely bar and reception area. Bad things: Reception staff unfriendly, despite it being advertised a s a non smoking hotel - guests still smoked freely and staff were unable to control this, walls were very thin - therefore you could hear every step and door slam (could be very annoying). This is a nice hotel but is just let down by some basic things i.e the smoking and noise problem. It is recommended if you want somewhere to laze about near a pool in the middle of the city, the gym and pool area are a definate bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, but not quite my style.”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel2012
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice one, if you like old fashioned, quaint, and reminds you of Jane Austen novels. The service is good, location excellent, overall clean and comfortable. No complaints. Given the selection of nicer hotels in Toronto, probably won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaHabana
Reviews.Content: Definitly my best hotel experience in Toronto yet! The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful, giving off a very rich european charm. The service from the minute I walked in the front lobby was great. We were very happy with our hotel room, clean/comfortable. I was lucky to be upgraded to a suite - which was beyond my expectations. (2 bathrooms, 2 queen size beds, 2 wide screen tvs, etc etc). Fantastic view of the city! The location of the hotel is excellent - walkimg distance to Toronto's main attractions, restaurants, nightclubs, etc. Subway is an option as well! The underground parking allows you to take your car in and out as your please at a flat rate fee (reasonable). Most parking lots in Toronto make you pay each time you come in and out. I didnt try the restaurants but the menus looked great - lots of variety and reasonable pricing. Overall, this is an exscellent hotel choice for anyone! (I used it as a place to stay for a girls night out downtown with my friends). It is definitly family-friendly, great for couples, singles, etc. I would highly reccommend The Sutton Place Hotel for anyone's stay downtown Toronto. Email me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service!!”
Reviews.Author: anlija
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sutton Place for 3 nights. I made reservation through Priceline and the price was very good. However, when we arrived, they did not have rooms with 2 beds available, and Priceline does not garantee a certain room type. We have a family of 4. The hotel offered us an apartment in the same building, 2 rooms, a sofa bed ain the living room, a queen size bed in the bedroom. 2 TV sets. Small kitchen with all amenities as well. The apartment was clean, but not 4 star. It was great for us, since we had more room for the kids. The location was perfect: walking distance to everything. The concierge Steve was superb. He gave us recommendations for activities, booked excellent restaurants and was always so nice and polite. We really enjoyed our stay!! O and my son left his favorite monkey toy there. We called the hotel the same night we left. They found it and sent it back ASAP. Little monkey is back with us!

Reviews.Title: “I am disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Cal_yee
Reviews.Content: Booked at Sutton based on reviews and was very disappointed. They charge you for everything, including local telephone calls. Learned that I have to ask how much each request cost the hard way. Overcharged on the bill, but was amenable to correction. The walls were VERY THIN. I could carry on a conversation with my neighbor without much effort. The room and the hotel was nice enough, but not worth the money. Friends stayed at hotels in the area at about the same price and class with a lot more compensations.

Reviews.Title: “want this hotel but at a fraction of the cost?”
Reviews.Author: Shmees
Reviews.Content: check out "Apartments on Bay at the Sutton Place Hotel", if you want to benefit from the location of this hotel but you don't need luxury and you want a great deal.... the hotel is great but on the top floors they have furnished apartments that are less luxurious but inexpensive. You get to enjoy the lobby of the hotel and take the same elevators as the other guests, but you are in apartment style rooms on the top floors -- with the best views!

Reviews.Title: “A 5 Star Hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: cagney91
Reviews.Content: My wife and I sold our Toronto home last year . We still travel to Toronto at least once a week to attend cultural events,have lunches and dinners with friends,and to visit family members. We stayed at several downtown Toronto hotels during the last 10 months to determine which one suited us best . We are now convinced that the best value in a 5 Star Hotel in Toronto is Sutton Place. The location at Wellesley is a pleasant walk from The Royal Ontario Museum,The Eaton Centre,the shops on Bloor St.,Yorkville, the ROM,and The Royal Conservatory of Music. There are also several excellent restaurants in the general area of the hotel. The hotel is only one block from the Wellesley bus and subway station at Yonge St. The amenities of Sutton Place are the equal of most Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton Hotels at a significantly lower price It is now our home away from home ,and the courteous and helpful staff at all levels make us feel most welcome My wife and I have travelled to most countries in the world on business or pleasure,and have stayed at some of the highest-rated(and highest -priced) hotels in those countries. Sutton Place is the equal of many and provides luxurious accommodation at a competitive price. I recommend Sutton Place whole-heartedly to all business or leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bootsydoodle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I regularly stay at the Sutton Place in downtown Toronto when we decide we need a quick weekend get away! I love the Sutton for it's location and history. The rooms are charming and it still has the feel of a grand old hotel. It is within walking distance to Yorkville and all the great shops and restaurants. If you can get a room on the top floors they have balcony's and the suites feel like an apartment in the city. Note that it isn't the newest hotel in the city but that makes it even better as the rooms are more generous and the room rates are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: UsaLovestoTravel
Reviews.Content: I am new to this trip advisor thing and it is great! I have had several trips to Toronto and have found this hotel to be clean, service is great. the rooms are Ok but the staff makes up for it. - I am surprised how wonderful this hotel is for the price. Great location

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel !”
Reviews.Author: flora1980
Reviews.Content: From the word go the staff were rude, unco-operative & generally incompetant. They would not let us check in without leaving a substantial deposit supposedly to cover mini bar charges & when they did finally let us in, there was no mini bar any way ! Walls were paper thin, had a rowing couple in the room next door & a randy couple across the hall ! Barely slept the entire stay ! All in all, major disaster, wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmum
Reviews.Content: From the outside, it looks like a tall apartment building, but inside it has apparently been recently renovated and is very nice; a nice surprise. The lobby is large and nicely decorated, with a large lounge off to the side, and many places to sit. The room was a pleasant surprise too, considering the prices are very reasonable right now. Very comfy bed, quiet apart from the usual later night people coming back to their rooms, which surprised me as the hotel appeared to be on the empty side. The fitness centre was very nice. Location is good depending on what you want. We wanted to be close to Bloor Street rather than the Mall/Eaton centre. It is indeed a few blocks from Bloor Street with the great stores, ROM, Shoe Mus., etc. We also did walk to the AGO and various other places right down town. Might be a bit far if you're really not a walker, but we prefered the area than down by the water or the Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home in a good location”
Reviews.Author: johnPerpignan
Reviews.Content: For the price charged,The Sutton Place offers an excellent deal. As I'd booked this at a bargain rate on Hotels.com,I did not expect an upgrade,so was not disappointed when one was not offered. The standard room was more than adequate,comfy bed and spotlessly clean. Closing the fridge seems a bit niggardly,but I guess it's becoming common practice these days. For a city hotel there was acres of storage space,and the front desk/concierge were helpful and efficient...far better than places I've stayed in in USA. Ate in the hotel for b'fast twice,and it was fine,if a bit pricey...Tim Horton across the road does a brekky deal in the typical N American way. As for evening dining options,well Toronto is seventh heaven. My tip for those on a short time...take the No 6 bus from outside the hotel 3 or 4 stops to Elm St,which seems to be a bit of a restaurant area,with Steakhouse,Pub,Portuguese, French,Veggie and an EXCELLENT Thai. 5 mins walk to Wellesley TTC metro Station,and that opens up other possibilities,ind Chinatown and Little India. Sutton Place will not satisfy those who demand whistles and flutes with everything,but for those who want genuine non-chain luxury and friendly efficiency at a bargain price will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: onlythebestOntario
Reviews.Content: We got a king room for $111 in their '48 hour sale' and it is now our hotel of choice in Toronto. Friendly, helpful no-fuss staff and a large, comfortable and clean room. A delight!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great room, great service”
Reviews.Author: mid214
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant two day stay at the Sutton. We were upgraded to a deluxe room without being asked and were very pleased with the accomodations - comfortable bed, clean room and bathroom. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous with all our requests and we ended up making an unplanned all day trip to Niagara Falls with their help. We did not use the hotel restaurant, found a very nice, cheaper little place just doors away with a few tables where you could sit outside. Our only quibble: the walls are too thin and the second night we could hear much too much of the conversation going on in the room next door.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Toronto Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Sophie0811
Reviews.Content: I love this place and hope to stay there again in October 2009. It is located close to everything - Financial, Theatre, Shopping District. I am not sure if all the rooms were as large as ours, as we had a corner room, but it was a simple luxury. The hotel staff members are very helpful, there is a gift shop, the lobby is well decorated, and wonderful Tim Horton's Donut shop right opposite. There is also a small Indian grocery store with great coffee, oranges, newspapers, etc. which we often visited for snacks. We did not eat at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not entirely satisfied...”
Reviews.Author: JackNLondon
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here for 6 nights in late August and we were not entirely satisfied with the hotel. Cleanliness: The room was generally rather clean and so was the bathroom - the housekeeping do a good job. the hotel lobby is also clean and so are the elevators... Location: The location is good because it's within walking distance of museums and parks, and Wellesely subway station is right there. The location is also good because Yonge street is there and you can walk to Dundas Sq. / Eaton Centre in about 15 minutes (or you can be lazy and take the subway)! However, we did notice that this end of Yonge street did seem to have a lot of beggars everywhere - be it sitting on the street asking for spare change, or going into McDonald's and making a fuss to get a free meal or coffee. Rooms: We stayed in a Sutton Double room which was pleasantly large with nice furniture and decor. However, it was the room we stayed in which caused me to give the review an overall 3 rating rather than a 4. There were several issues which arose within 20 minutes of entering the room. Firstly, we noticed our room used to be part of a connecting room, and so we could hear practically everything being said next door - even what TV show was being watched. On the first night when we were jet-lagged from our 7.5 hour flight, the female in the room next door was arguing with her boyfriend ALL NIGHT so we never got even a wink of sleep. Secondly, the in-room safe did not work (we tried several methods several times) so we ended up calling reception and then about 5 people came to our room to fix one safe??? Anyway so in the end they re-activated it or something and it worked (but it wasted like 30 mins of our evening). And last but not least, our room had a balcony with a really lame view - the roof of floors 1-3 of the hotel - but the view was not the problem. The balcony door did NOT lock!
