We therefore felt quite unsafe since we were not on a high floor (Thank God we got the safe working). Service: The receptionists were rather efficient and check-in took like 2 minutes. There was also free coffee in the lobby on some mornings - depending on what time you got up. Value: Overall we got a rather good deal on the room as we booked a flight + hotel through expedia.co.uk. Had we paid a 5 star price, however, we would have definitely been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star - In a Pig's Eye!”
Reviews.Author: Jamison
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here back in the 80's, when it was a newer, more glamourous hotel ( one that actually attracted stars, before the new hotel building boom of the past decade). I read the reviews cautiously, hoping others travellers were either totally jaded or given poor on line discounter rooms. I booked on their web site, joined their member club and thought I was homefree to at least a satisfying stay..... I booked a 2 bedroom/2 bath LUXURY suite with a balcony. At check in ( at the very late hour of 3 in the afternoon!) I was told that there were no balcony suites available and that the 2 bath units were all taken by guests checking in earlier. I then asked if we could change to 2 single balcony king rooms and were told, yes, but at a rate nearly double what I had prepaid. No apologies, no attempts to rectify the situation, just glassy eyes. Our luxury suite was a very tired 70's condo style apartment. The carpeting had seen many a party, the furniture was a curious mismash of older traditional hotel furnishings and hideous big box store discounted items. We has 2 flat screen TV's without HD capability. The bathroom was large enough for one small person and adequate if they didn't want to shower. There is no fan and very poor lighting.The shower head was installed sometime during the Carter administration and not only was placed too low for anyone over 5 foot, but sprayed water EVERYWHERE. We were given 2 towels for 4 people. A Mariott Fairfield provides better quantity and quality of toiletries. As a member of their loyalty program I was entitled to free internet - a ridiculous charge of $18 a day , with a non operational business center - this 'privilege was ony 'won' after 2 calls to the desk and a personal visit. The pool and health club area is an insider secret. It is nearly impossible to find ( it is listed as being on the on the third floor, but ris really on the second- insider tip, get off on the 2nd, make a right from the elevator, go to the door ,marked men's by the white piano). The health club is adequate, most of the limited equipment worked. The pool is VERY small and best for a short person who enjoys doing short laps in very cold water. A very nice sunning terrace is off the pool with tables and chaises. Do not attempt to bring your own beverages or food there, even in plastic cups; you will be 'busted' - something that has never happened to me at a true 5 star resort. Summary:Location is central, but not on the pulse of things- its a 15 minute walk to Yorkville and 20+ minute commute downtown. Parking is typically overpriced. Public areas are still quite elegant, but declining. Restaurant is unimaginative and very overpriced ( try the grocer down the block ( Rabbas) for take out and incidentals. Rooms are very overpriced for a dearth of style and service. I imagine in the next couple of years, they will either infuse millions in renovation or close or become a Ramada.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: candylkemeHerndon
Reviews.Content: I was a little on guard when I walked into this hotel, because of previous reviews, but was very satisfied at the service we received at this hotel. The room was clean, spacious and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was a little small but we received a great price with Priceline, so I was satisfied. We were given a room that overlooked the street, which was great. I dreaded a view of a building or a roof. We asked for a change of towels on two seperate days of our stay and the Maid service was there within 5 minutes of our call. We also had a problem with the TV (no picture) which they responded to immediately. The Hotel staff was very friendly and extemely helpful. We were overcharged for parking and the internet and when we brought this to the attention of the front desk, they quickly credited us for the mistake. The restaurant, which we visited for breakfast was good, the meals were a little pricy but not uncommon for a downtown Toronto Hotel. If you choose to have a lighter unhealthy breakfast, there is Tim Hortons directly across the street. Now I did read the reviews on the great Location, but wasn't exactly satisfied with the location. yes you are close to shopping and museums, but you have to walk about 3 or 4 blocks to get to anything. Not really too much close to the Hotel except for a convenience store accross the street and a French Restaurant, also across the street. If you don't mind walking long distances then I recommend this hotel. I have stayed in other Hotels in Downtown Toronto before and have walked out to restaurants and shopping, which are either right next to or across the street from the hotel.This is not the case with Sutton Place. I Guess it is a matter of what you like to do. Parking is 25.00 per night and it is hard to get around this since there are only a few 24 hour public lots and they are not really all that close. Not quite sure I would classify this as a 4 star hotel, maybe 3 and a half.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service destroys it all.”
Reviews.Author: yellowplum
Reviews.Content: Depends on what you are expecting, the Sutton Place Hotel in Toronto may not be your best bet. The rooms are very nice, marble floored bathroom and spacious room. The establishment is old but very well kept. The fees for services are, of course, just like any 5-star hotels, expensive...but the service we received were unfortunately, not measuring up to the prices charged. For instance, staff members were not courteous nor welcoming -doorman was impolite at valet parking, check-in staff member was slow but unapologetic (watied for 15 mins for her to process our check-in). my niece called in from outside and the operator was impolite ('I NEED YOU TO TELL ME THE GUEST'S NAME!!!'). This being said, the location of this hotel is great - close to most tourist spots and public transit.

Reviews.Title: “Boo Sutton”
Reviews.Author: BigCityLover
Reviews.Content: My rate was great. $100/night I was attending a wedding at this hotel. That is why I stayed there, otherwise I would have stayed at my preferred hotel Royal York. The hotel location was somewhat central. Rooms were alright. Nothing special. But the attitude of the staff was poor. From the reception to the door staff everyone thought they were doing me a favor. And the there is no mini bar or fridge in the rooms. Need to order room service. Pretty sad for a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Try Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: LindsayTait
Reviews.Content: I'll start off by saying that we were assigned this hotel when we booked through Hotwire. I booked two nights, and if I could have gotten my money back and changed hotels, I certainly would have. After using Hotwire several times, I was confident that we would get a beautiful hotel and room, and this is the first time that we have been disappointed. The hotel is located on Bay Street, right downtown. It was a convenient location, with lots of places to go nearby within walking distance. There is underground parking available at the hotel. You can either park yourself, or use a valet. We parked ourselves, and it was $25/night. Not too bad for Toronto. Checking-in was easy, and the ladies at the desk were very nice, and helpful. When we checked-in we were given a room on the third floor, with two double beds. I asked if it were possible to get a room with a King, and was told that the whole hotel was booked and they had nothing available. We went up to our room on the third floor, and it was quite large. Everything was clean, and nicely made up. The view from our room (3018), however, was the roof of another building that went up at an angle. So, it basically looked like we were in a cave. I went into the bathroom, and it was not even as big as my bathroom at home (which isn't saying much!). It was quite cramped. There was no light in the shower, and the curtain was only maybe an inch or so from the ceiling, so when you closed the curtain it also was like being in a cave! And the shower head wasn't very good either. That evening when we went out, we checked with the front desk to see if it would be possible to change rooms the following day. They had another room available on the 10th floor with a Queen bed, so we said we would change to that one. We were planning on being out the following day, so they asked that we have all of our things packed up, and they would move it to our new room while we were out. The ladies at the desk asked that we just come back to the desk when we returned to the hotel, and we could go to our new room and our things would be there for us. That night when we returned, I noticed that I could perfectly hear the conversation the women in the next room were having. If you're looking for a little privacy, this is not the place. The following morning we woke up, and went out for the morning and early afternoon. When we returned we went to the front desk, and got our key cards for the new room. Our luggage had not been taken to our new room as discussed, however, so we had to arrange all of that. The new room with the Queen (1003) was much smaller than the previous one, but at least we could sleep together! The view onto Bay St. was also an improvement. No improvement on the bathroom situation, though. In the evening we went down to the pool. It's quite a bit smaller than other hotel pools I've been to. The water was a little chilly, but we went swimming anyway. A lady with two children came down while we were there, but when they felt the temperature of the water the mother decided it was too cold to go in. The poor little girls were disappointed in that. Off of the pool there is a really nice patio area with lounge chairs and patio tables and chairs. If you are looking for a place to relax, this is a really nice spot. The following morning I was looking forward to enjoying the morning paper, as I had the previous morning, but unfortunately they didn't deliver one. The only thing they left us was the bill for parking. As I said earlier, we have used Hotwire before, and have enjoyed really nice hotels such as Delta and Westin. If I had booked a 3 star, I would have expected something along the lines of Sutton Place. I had booked a 4 star, though, and didn't feel like this hotel was in the same league. It really needs a make-over to come up to parr with other 4 stars. The prices that they ask for normally are a little high for the quality of room you get. I don't even think that the price I paid through Hotwire was much of a deal considering.

Reviews.Title: “Three Stars at best”
Reviews.Author: holla_eight
Reviews.Content: Now to begin we got a deal on the room so my complaint can't be that harsh, however the rooms were no better than the holiday inn, in fact the only thing impressive about this hotel was the lobby everything else just seemed sub-par. The room itself was small and there were no plugs anywhere in the room. The decor was minimal and the overall feeling was a bit dismal. The room we were given was on the third floor with not much view, except of the pool of filth that had formed above their marquee. I would recommend that people think twice before staying at the Sutton Place, whose only major draw was its central location.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: special_cay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton Place on New Year's Eve for a nice night in Yorkville. We had to switch rooms as soon as we got there because the first room we were given (which was supposed to be a suite), looked like we had to decorate it- and clean it- ourselves in order to stay there. We complained and were quicly switched to a better room in the older part of the hotel, which was fine. The biggest complaint was the bathroom- so small that two of us could barely brush our teeth at the same time. The other complaint was that at 4am the fire alarm went off and we had to evacuate, but that was more likely caused by the rowdy drunks who were also staying there for the holiday. Overall, we expected more from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you are looking for...”
Reviews.Author: mommyofacutie
Reviews.Content: Ok, so first of all, if I had paid regular price for a room, I would be extremely disappointed. But seeing as I got the room for a special rate ($100 CDN per night) through a promotion they were running, my review will be a little kinder. I arrived by myself for one night and then my husband was joining me the next day after work for our second night. He self-parked and said that the lot was underground and that the spaces were a little tight but manageable. It was just nice to have an underground lot, especially since it was pouring rain. It is $25 with full in & out priveledges. If you are coming and going a lot, it might be worth it to pay the $33 for valet. I walked into the hotel and it's gorgeous. They describe it as European Elegance and it's definitely that! You feel like you've just walked into a hotel in Paris. The decor is old but has a lot of charm. Although there was a lineup at the check-in desk, they were very quick and I only had to wait a few minutes. The staff do seem beaten down though. I didn't get many smiles and they were very monotone when they spoke. No one seemed happy to be there. I got to my room, it was a standard room (1 queen) with a balcony. From what I could tell, all the rooms on the east side of the building have balconies and the ones on the west side do not. Now, just so you know, I have NEVER complained at a hotel or restaurant in my life. I am being serious. My husband is the one who usually has a few words if he is unhappy but I avoid confrontation at all costs. Now, saying this, I broke that record with this trip. The first room on the 6th floor, although standard, was still fine... except for the balcony door wouldn't shut properly and the room was freezing. The doors to the balcony are very old. So I went down to the front desk and told them that I needed another room as the door was broken. The girl gave me a look of disbelief which just made me mad but I kept it in. Still, she gave me a new room on the 10th floor. I walked into that, this one was the same standard room but without the balcony. It reeked of smoke. I turned around and went back downstairs. At this point, I am not happy. I am still soaked from the rain, I am dragging 3 bags and one of the elevators was broken. This time, it was the same person who checked me in. I told him the room smelled of smoke and he said "this is a non smoking hotel". UGH! I told him that I understand that but the room I just walked into reeked of smoke and although I can't explain how it happened, I need another room as my husband is asthmatic and smoke really bothers him. So he started looking through his computer for a room and finally said "I will see if there are any bigger rooms available". You would think that upon the first room not being okay, if they had any upgraded rooms, they would have given it to me. But I really felt like because I got a deal on the room, I was being treated differently. And the silly part is that the promotion for the rate was put on by the hotel, not a travel site. Anyway, he found me a King room also on the 10th floor. This room was perfect - no issues at all. It had a balcony with a door that shut properly and did not have any bad smells. :) The king room is probably 20% bigger than the standard room but does feel much more open. There was a big flatscreen tv (maybe 47 - 50 inches?) and lots of closet space. I thought to be nice, I would call down and thank the man at the desk for the room - but when I did, he didn't seem to care at all. Ok, so Accents Restaurant (in the hotel). I had a friend meet me for dinner, it was 10pm and the restaurant was open until 11pm. I had a coupon for 50% off the food that I had received when I booked the room so we thought we check it out. We went down to the restaurant and it was very fancy. We felt out of place in our jeans but as it wasn't busy, stayed anyway. The host immediately said "the bar?" and we said "no, dinner please" and he proceeded to look at his watch, say "oh yes, there's still time I guess" huff and take us to our table. He seemed upset that we were ordering dinner!!! I had the chicken club and my friend had the fish & chips. My chicken club was awesome! I couldn't finish it so they kindly wrapped up the other half for me. The fish was hand breaded, stacked on a pile of chickpeas and roasted potatoes and there was a homemade tartar sauce poured ontop of it all. I had a bite and it was excellent! I'm not sure if it's worth it for full price though. The full price of the sandwich was $15 and the fish $17. When I gave him the coupon, he seemed very upset. I did tip on the regular amount though which seemed to lift his spirits. I think they are used to people only calculating the tip on the reduced amount. The bed was okay. It's supposed to be some sort of special chiropractic bed. I personally prefer my pillowtop bed I have at home. The next morning, I ordered room service. Had the eggs benedict and it was delicious!! Since I didn't put the card out the morning before, it did take about an hour for my food to arrive but I expected that. If you put the card out, you get delivery of your food at the time you request it. I wasn't going to order interenet to my room but since I had the entire day to kill before my husband was going to arrive, I called down and ordered it for 24 hours. It's $16.50 which is definitely expensive but I do have to say that it was fast! I was able to stream music while playing an online game and never had any problems. And I was accessing it wirelessly. I will say that the benefit to this hotel bar none is the balcony!! You don't get a fantastic view or anything but not a lot of hotels offer balconies and during the afternoon when the sun came out for a bit, I sat out there and enjoyed it. The only downside is that there aren't any chairs out there but the desk chair worked fine for me. The water pressure was no good in the shower but that's to be expected with an older hotel. I did go to the pool - it is a small square pool, deepest point is 1.17 metres. It's still nice if you just want to wade around and relax. I did some laps and that was fine too. Keep in mind that the sauna is turned off so I would recommend turning it on before you get in the pool if you want to have a sauna afterwards. I did check out the workout room and it was quite nice! The final morning, I awoke to our bill that had been slipped under the door - and it was so wrong! They had charged us for 2 nights of valet parking when we only had 1 night of self park. They charged twice for the internet but I only ordered it for 24 hours. They charged me for a long distance phone call when all I did was pick up the phone, dial a number (without the 1 infront) and get the Bell Canada voice telling me to hang up and dial again (so I just used my cell instead). Upon checkout, I gave her the list of items that were wrong and she credited my card. Honestly, if I had paid anymore money, I would have been furious!! We stay in Toronto every year at this time as my husband has a work function. Honestly, I won't stay here again. Too many problems. We had a much better time last year at the Mariott Courtyard over one block. BUT I did talk to several business travellers who really enjoyed their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired room and unhappy clerk”
Reviews.Author: Poetryprofessor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sutton last month Clerk at the front desk was very sad : ( Made me wonder if they are paid or are simply forced to be there. Room itself was also very sad and tired. I would not be back.S

Reviews.Title: “An overpriced 3-Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Khoazy
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Sutton Place Toronto over the past weekend. Booked on Priceline as a 4-Star hotel, for about $100CDN/Night; booking other 4-Star hotels for similar prices in the past. Hoping to do some Christmas shopping over the holidays, we wanted to be downtown. Upon arrival Saturday afternoon, the doorman told me parking was $25/Night with no in/out privileges or $36 a day with full privileges. I went to check in and asked the front desk if there was cheaper parking anywhere? â€œNo sorry, you canâ€™t find cheap parking in downtown.â€� On the corner of this hotel (Bay / St. Patrick) is the St. Basil Church, where we paid only $17 to park for three days (no in/out privileges)! At least the money went to the local church instead of a hotel chain. (Thanks helpful hotel staff...) The hotel was deserted, and we only saw one other couple during our stay. The lobby was decent but empty, with more hotel staff then guest to serve. The tiles were painted, and although I understand the charm of Victorian dÃ©cor, thereâ€™s a fine line between classy and out-of-date. Unfortunately, this hotel is out of date! For the prices theyâ€™re charging, I was disappointed. We got a free room upgrade, which was not a big deal considering the hotel was completely empty. The room we got appeared to be standard, which makes me concerned about what the regular rooms looked like. The room itself wasnâ€™t that bad, and served its purpose with a comfortable bed, furniture, and LCD television with lots of additional channels. The bathroom was small, and the top vent connected to the outside. This usually isnâ€™t a big deal, except we were there during a snow storm and could hear loud winds all night coming from the bathroom. The worst part was that the connection outside caused the bathroom to be freezing cold, with no temperature control to warm it up. The location of Sutton Place is excellent, lots of shopping, restaurants, and we utilized the TTC subway system (www.ttc.ca) to get around ($9 for a day pass: good for couples or entire families on weekends). We loved riding the subway, which was fast, avoided usual traffic, no parking, and the cold weather never affected us. This was the first hotel Iâ€™ve been to where I couldnâ€™t open my window coveringsâ€¦ There is absolutely no view available, with a huge business office across the street on one side and looking into condos only several metres away on the other side. (See pictures of view) I decided to go for a workout on my first morning, which took me forever to find the gym. Listed on the 3rd floor in the elevator, it was nowhere to be found. I wondered down to the 2nd floor, where it was dark and deserted. After wondering through the old hotel like a haunted movie, I found a small run-down workout area, there was no heat, and half the machines didnâ€™t work. No thanks! So I thought to myself, the pool has to be closeâ€¦ And it was, a small square pool that measured about 8m X 8m and at its deepest measured 1.17m, making it more of a large kids pool then anything else. Over dinner, we discussed how long the hotel was going to be operational. Considering they were charging the same prices that Iâ€™ve paid at the Sheraton & Hilton in downtown Toronto, I really donâ€™t see how they can compete. And with nobody in a hotel with well over 30 floors, they obviously are not doing well. This hotel is comparable to the Delta Downtown Toronto (only blocks away), which measures 3-Stars. The Deltaâ€™s prices reflect that quality, and they are always full for such a huge hotel. Perhaps itâ€™s time to update the quality of Sutton Place from 4-Stars to 3-Stars, reflecting its out-dated dÃ©cor and average satisfaction rating from everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room!”
Reviews.Author: netgeek
Reviews.Content: I was really quite nervous about coming to this hotel after reading the reviews. I booked it on priceline and got a great deal. When I arrived check in was very quick. I was lucky enough to get upgraded to suite. It was a beautiful LARGE room with two bathrooms. I really liked how in my suite when I first come in I walk down a fairly long 'hallway' (dont see the light shining through from under the door or hear the noise when people close their doors). I really liked the two 36 inch LCD TVs. Beautiful furnishings (older style). The bed was really comfy. I didnt really find the staff to be overly friendly, but by no means were they rude.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: blkjck5697
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via a Priceline bid, and I was a little concerned about the hotel after reading some of the reviews here. Things aren't as bad as earlier reviewers have made the point on, but maybe the hotel can fix things right away, some they can't. Checkin was efficient, and while I was not overwhelmed by the room size, it was clean. The furniture looks like it could use a modernization, it was not in bad shape. The bathroom was small, and you could hear the neighbour using his shower and washroom. Public transportation access is not an issue. Being right on Bay Street, transit buses are pleniful. The Wellesley subway stop in two blocks away, and is on one of Toronto's main lines. Restaurants are plenty in the area, and there is a 24 hour supermarket just a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms; generally pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: cpdad
Reviews.Content: Hotel is generally well-maintained and has good-quality furnishings in large guest rooms. The television appeared to be relatively new and had a large, thin LCD screen; it was very nice. Unfortunately, bathrooms are a bit on the small side, but were adequate. We had a room on the lowest floor, with two "full-sized" beds (no, not queen size) which were certainly big enough. Room also had a marble-topped wet bar behind doors; this was of no value to us except for the small refrigerator. Generally, with better services and amenities this property could approach a 5* level. I found it odd that the room contained a coffee-maker (located on the dresser), but there was no electrical outlet nearby. Had I wanted to use it, I would have had to carry it into the bathroom - the wet bar also lacked an outlet. The point here is that this amenity was not well implemented and I wonder if this is symptomatic of the way this hotel operates. Another example of poor execuion is to designate my room as "non-smoking" but with a connecting door to another room that was apparently "smoking". My room smelled fresh at time of check-in, but after a guest checked-in the next day into the adjacent room, my room reeked of cigarette smoke. Here again, assuming the guest was not smoking in a "non-smoking" room for over two days, it seems poorly thought-out to have a connecting door between smoking and non-smoking rooms. Location is good, within walking distance to the trendy Yorkville neighborhood. We prefer to use public transportation as much as possible when we visit cities, and the Sutton Place is close to a subway station and a bus route is just outside the front door. We did not use any of the hotel facilities: pool, food & beverage, parking, etc so cannot comment on those. The minimal interactions we had with front desk staff were satisfactory, but we were definitely not impressed by the alleged "friendliness" that other posters have noted. Staff provided the bare minimum assistance without elaboration on two occasions, even though there were no other guests at the desk. Not a big deal, but it's one more thing that will keep this hotel from operating in a more upscale market niche. In summary, I would stay here again because the overall experience was nice, but we would decline a room with a connecting door.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice (for the price)”
Reviews.Author: SFGuy35
Reviews.Content: When this hotel popped up after making a reservation on Hotwire, I was definitely nervous, due to the negative reviews. But it turned out to be surprisingly luxurious, a good bargain, and a good base for a Toronto visit. My hotwire rate was under $100, and while the front desk had a little trouble with the reservation at first, they were nice about it and then told me they'd given me an upgrade. I walked into the room and was amazed -- it was a suite with two very large rooms and two bathrooms, two large TVs, couch, and desk, much more room than I needed. The decor does seem to be from another era, with a lot of chintzy gold in the hallways and white marble, but it was very clean. At one point only one of the four elevators seemed to be working, causing some delays, as there was a wedding taking place in the hotel at the time. It made for some amusing elevator conversations. Other than that there were no issues. High speed internet is very expensive at $17/day but don't buy it -- there's a coffeeshop just a few doors down that has free wi-fi. The general location is a bit off the beaten track, quite a ways from downtown, but actually close to some interesting restaurants and shops on Yonge and Church streets as well as a subway station. The health club was adequate, although the pool is very small. All in all, Sutton Place ended up being better overall than the Delta Chelsea, another hotel in the area I've stayed at with a similar Hotwire price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel624
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton Aug. for 4 days. I was a bit leary because of the previous reviews however we were on a limited budget and the location was good for us. Our room was #512 and was very large and clean. I'm not sure what others ment by the rooms out date. We had 2 queens size beds, nicely appointed, flat screen TV, desk chairs, safe, and okay size clean bathroom. Upon arrival our safe wasn't working and room service came up within minutes to fix it. The only negative was that our room was situtated beside the bank of elevators so it was very noisy at night with the elevators moving up and down. We didn't seem to notice it during the day time however we weren't there alot of the time. Parking was kind of expensive $28 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ss06qy
Reviews.Content: When I got to Sutton place I was nicely greeted with an upgrade to a queen suite instead of the regular queen room. The room was really clean and pleasant looking. The front desk was friendly although the lady at reservation gave us the wrong info about the payment over the phone, overall I enjoyed the stay and will definitely visit again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for bussines”
Reviews.Author: Warezz_IRL
Reviews.Content: Company that i work for booked that hotel for me. Reception nice and profesional. Rooms warm and modern. Staff very pleasant. great hotel for bussines purposess.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED our stay in the apartments”
Reviews.Author: pirate-elle
Reviews.Content: We were meeting a group of friends at the hotel for the weekend and booked a long-stay apartment for 4 nights as we were traveling with our infant daughter and needed a room with a separate area for her to sleep and a kitchen. Our 1 bedroom apartment was perfect. Great location, wonderful pool, nice hotel staff (the valet remembered us every day and played with our daughter). The room was extremely spacious for the excellent price we paid, and although the furniture was old, it was perfect for our little family. The bed was comfy, kitchen stocked. There is only once a week maid service, but there was a linen closet filled with tons of towels, blankets, pillows, extra soap and shampoo, and it was nice not having to pick up after the baby each day before the maid arrived. We couldn't have been happier with our stay and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not recommended”
Reviews.Author: nursemomruns
Reviews.Content: My two sons and I had originally booked one of their apartment rooms. The experience was similar to living in government subsidized housing on the south side of Chicago, or a run-down frat house. The pictures that are posted on their website are not representative of the current situation. We moved to the hotel part of the property after the first day. Things are definitely outdated there and the service is very poor. We made a few calls for towels (they gave us two towels for three people), before giving up and resorting to using the hand towels for the shower. The front desk staff and the doormen were pleasant, but the maintenance and housekeeping staff are rude and inconsiderate. They use the same elevator as the guests, so we had the pleasure of riding with a trolley full of smelly garbage. Parking is very expensive, as is the charge for wireless internet. It is not close to major attractions, but is close to the subway, which is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Sutton Place not a 4 Stars as paid on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: saze86
Reviews.Content: Hi, I go to Toronto often for work and use priceline to book my hotels. For the first time i was booked a more like 3 star hotel then 4 star like i paid for. This hotel is a good 3 star but definitely not a 4 star. Know what you pay for and beware of this kind of hotel that has found ways to impress even the people at priceline to get a star value they do not have. Even the front desk could not say this hotel was 4 star but where saying it's a 4 diamond, which is a canada only system which is not a strict as the star system. Travelers beware....

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: lovin-vietnam
Reviews.Content: Made a last minute booking here through Hotels.ca (which we have subsequently learned is the same as Expedia) because the Sutton Place in Vancouver is so wonderful. Had to book two rooms because we are four, specifically requested two beds in each room but were 'upgraded' to two rooms w king beds because they had no double rooms, Rooms were small, cramped, furniture was old, paint peeling, staff were surly. First night was a disaster, we were so squished and uncomfortable, decided to check out and find a two bedroom suite, but because we had booked through expedia found ourselves 'locked in' to staying in a totally unsuitable hotel. Spent 5 hours on the phone with expedia and with the manager of the hotel and were finally able to leave with assurances, but nothing confirmed, that we will get our money back. We are in Toronto on a family holiday that was planned months ago, our first reservation was cancelled at the last minute which is why we were in a pickle in the first place. Recommend that all negotiations with hotels.ca or expedia be approached with caution - customer satisfaction does not appear to be a priority - and do not recommend the Sutton Place in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: lighthouseboy
Reviews.Content: First, I got it on priceline for $69 so I can't complain too much. But for a 4* star, it is average at best. My big complain: I called a friend in Toronto (it's cheaper than roaming on my US based called) and there is NO pen and paper in the room. Hell, Motel 6 gives you that! Also, the TV was old (probably 10 yrs old) and the furnishing are neither 'antique' or modern. Note to Hyatt: Buy this hotel and convert it into a Hyatt Place. The rooms themselves are very spacious and HP could really make this into a good mid-range hotel in TO. And the staff at the Sutton Place were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: ok_the_way_i_am
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference here and was very disappointed with my hotel room and the hotel services. My room was quite outdated, especially the bathroom and just felt dingy. As a business traveller, you expect certain things out of a hotel and the Sutton did not live up to any of these expectations. Internet was $16.50 for 24 hours, the food with room service and in their restaurant was grossly over priced for the quality, and there was an issue with the TVâ€¦I was travelling with a colleague and her and I felt like watching a movie (Juno). We ordered the movie and the screen went blankâ€¦we tried numerous times to get it to come on and the screen stayed black. When the front desk was contacted, the lady at the desk rudely dismissed my concerns. She did send someone up to look at the TV who spoke little English and could not figure out what was wrong so told me to call back to the front desk. When I called back once again the lady was very rude and seemed aggravated when we asked her to remove the charge from the bill because we werenâ€™t able to watch the movie we wanted to. There were a few good things about the hotel, mainly the location (nice and close to everywhere) and the men working at the front doors. They were very friendly and helpful when we needed a cab or directions. I know my colleague and I were both disappointed with the hotel. Luckily our company was covering the costs, but it was disappointing to think that they had to. The conference room was nice, but the chairs were uncomfortable and the tables were super skinny, there were at least glasses broken during the conference because there was barely enough room for ones books, laptops, and water glassesâ€¦this should not be the case. I would not recommend this hotel at all, especially to people who are paying for it out of their own pockets. It is bound to be a disappointment. The one thing to note is they are improving the rooms and hotel, so I would consider going back in a couple of years, just to see the changes but not anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of care to the basics”
Reviews.Author: Clabbyroad
Reviews.Content: Stayed there twice this week, even got the same room with the same problems even after pointing them out Water control to bath/shower broken Television old and terrible picture No dressing gown on second stay Hotel staff pushed by guests on the lift to get out first Signage has not been replaced in months For the "name/image" it is trying to advertize it is not even close when they can't get the basics correct.

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back again with no hesitation”
Reviews.Author: CaptainBristol
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just returned home after a 2-night, midweek stay at the Sutton Place Toronto. We are frequent travelers who usually stay in 4-star hotels and we thought the place was acceptable-to-very good. I got our room on Priceline by bidding $90 per night. With taxes and fees the price climbed to $110.61, which we thought was a good value. While we were there, the annual Genie Awards (Canada's version of the Oscars) banquet was being held in the top-floor banquet room, and the hotel was booked solid. We spotted lots of movie people--many of them recognizable stars. Despite the hubbub the staff seemed to handle everything with aplomb. We encountered no rudeness or indifference. The hotel employees just did their work efficiently, which is the best you can expect with a sold-out house. We got a perfectly-acceptable, south-facing corner room on the 12th floor. It was clean and bright and had a nice view of both Bay St. and the CN Tower. The king mattress was good quality but the in-room amenities were nothing special. The bathroom was smallish and plainish. The in-room coffee maker was stocked with upscale coffee but the creamer was that disappointing chemical glop that passes for dairy product. By calling the front desk and asking for the "free" password, we managed to avoid the $16.95 wireless Internet fee.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: History_Enthusiast
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this hotel to anyone - when we arrived, the front desk staff were rude and oblivious to our very presence. Our room was dirty and there was a general sense of uncleanliness. Water in the shower rose up to our calves and took forever to drain. Staff were snooty and unable to give us simple directions to the ROM which was only a few blocks away. The best part of this experience was when we got to leave. The only plus was its location.

Reviews.Title: “not too good, not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Jorge37
Reviews.Content: I got a huge room for a low price, with a walk-in closet, a balcony, kitchen, living room and bedroom. The hotel was pretty quiet and very central. BUT... everything looks old and is in serious need of a new coat of paint, the maid did not clean my room, and although local calls were said to be complimentary, I was charged for calling toll-free calls. I complained about the latter two negative points and not a thing was done. Overall, a lacklustre establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good (Not Great) Stay”
Reviews.Author: liquiddemon
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a few day in January of this year. I would only recommend the Sutton Place to an older couple or those that would appreciate an "old-school" feel in the hotel they choose. The lobby, elevator and common areas are very classy. And the furnishings in the room are antique-styled(?). Having a balcony is a nice touch as well ... although in the wintertime it's kind of a mute point. That's about it for the pluses ... well apart from the Priceline price. The tv was ridiculously old ... perhaps that's meant to be an antique as well? The Sutton Place might do well to consider an upgrade to the tv as I can't imagine anyone in their right mind would pay to watch a movie on such a screen. Can you say lost income? The bathroom is undersized compared to more modern hotels. Housekeeping seemed to take FOREVER or perhaps my room just happened to be at the end of their rounds? Plus they charged me for an item from their mini-bar that I didn't use. The fee was waved without incident upon checkout but I found that to be unprofessional of the person taking stock of the bar and it left a bad impression at the time I should have been considering a tip for the housekeeping. Ooops ... forgot to tip. I guess there's a first time for everything. As a side note I highly recommend a new restaurant that opened just down the street from the Sutton Place. It's a small Toronto chain called Magic Oven. I believe I was their first customer on their second day open. The pizza was absolutely fabulous. And the owner and wait staff could not have been more charming.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but hardly spectacular”
Reviews.Author: martureytoronto
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend New Years Eve at the Sutton. The first room they gave us was considered one of their 'apartment' suites. It was definitely an apartment equipped with a full kitchen, large bedroom, very unattractive bathroom and balcony. The room was VERY dated looking and it did NOT look like a hotel room. It appeared as though the furniture was purchased in the late 70s or early 80s (if that). This wasn't the hotel experience we were looking to have for New Years. We asked for another room and we were given a more traditional room that was fine but not really the luxury I was expecting from the Sutton. It was fine but nothing better then you'd get at a much less expensive hotel chain. It was kind of disappointing since the hotel lobby of the Sutton is so opulent. The location is good though for tourists to the city. The gym was pretty good too (treadmills, free weights, elliptical trainers). If you can get a deal at this hotel it's fine but if you're looking for something special or a bit of luxury, I'd look around. Staff were fine but nothing outstanding and the room was quite clean. The bed was comfortable as it was quite firm.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected Based on Rating”
Reviews.Author: Posada20
Reviews.Content: I researched hotels on another site (didn't know about this site at the time). Based on the number of stars this hotel was given, I expected a much better experience. The first room they gave me looked like the maid service was interrupted and never resumed (towels on the bathroom floor, garbage hadn't been emptied). The second room was clean but definitely not up to the standards I had expected, again, based on the star rating. The room was dark and a little dreary. However, keep in mind that I'm a smoker and requested a smoking room...maybe they don't keep up with those rooms as much as the non-smoking rooms? The hotel staff was not friendly or helpful at all. After checking out I had some time to kill before heading to the airport so I went out and got a sandwich. I came back to the hotel to eat in the lobby and read a magazine. I asked the concierge if she had any napkins (I forgot to grab some where I bought my sandwich) and her answer was "no". I was a bit annoyed by the one word, unhelpful answer and I guess it was obvious to the concierge because she said "is there a problem" and I said, "I just need some napkins" and she said "oh, well you should have asked, I can go get them from the restaurant". As far as I'm concerned, she should have said that from the start..."no, but I'll go grab some for you in the restaurant". Her tone was snotty until she returned with the napkins. Whatever! Not a great experience. The location is ok if you need to take the subway, which is only 1 1/2 blocks away. I was there for the Yankees/Blue Jays games so I did use the subway but overall, I wish I had stayed downtown near Rogers Centre...there's a lot to do in that area vs. nothing to do near the Sutton. Oh, the other site also said that celebrities stay at this hotel...can't imagine any celebrity staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotels for value”
Reviews.Author: nathanmuir
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler to Toronto, I have a few favorite hotels but always look for good deals on Expedia. I found a good price for a room and booked a night (arrived Sunday). There is nothing "wrong" with the hotel but there's nothing _great_ with the hotel either and for its hotel rating, it ought to be better. The Room service menu is limited and - from what I ordered - lacking in quality. The sheets are cheapish, the internet connectivity slow (despite paying for daily access) and the wireless in the lobby totally unreliable. I felt that this was a 3 star hotel experience for a 4-star price. There are better hotels to stay at so unless you're getting an incredibly good deal or this is very close to your meeting place, I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: seabass872
Reviews.Content: I liked the Sutton Place. Hotel was quite upscale, although the furniture in the room was somewhat dated. Valet parking was $33/day, whick I thought was pretty steep. If you park yourself, it is still $25/day. Staff was friendly and helpful. Hotel is located about 2 blocks from the Wellesey metro station, a short walk even in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: GermantownMD
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous, five star hotel. The room was lovely and spacious, as was the bathroom. The service was great. They have a nice pool and a full exercise room. This is a great location. Close to Yonge and Bloor, the Eaton Center, ROM, and the University. We had a hard time getting internet service in the room, although they have a full business center.

Reviews.Title: “Sutton Hotel Toronto”
Reviews.Author: enjoyToronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sutton Hotel for a day and check-in was fine but the room was crappy. We were given room next to elevator and could sleep the whole night. I did tell front desk in the morning and the lady said they were sold oft that is why I got the room. Then changed the story and said you did not call during the night , if you have we could have changed the room. I have also spoke to front desk manager and she said they were not sold off and she could have given better room. I think they knew the problem and had other rooms and did not want to give us good room to me. I will never ever stay in that hotel. Noisy room and rude front desk is enough for one time and they acted as if I stayed for fr

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suite”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelledOntario
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late in the evening, reception was great. My room was situated on the 12th floor. When I opened the room door I was amazed at the entrance, where was the usual room? I found myself in a 1300 square foot suite. Very spacious, I was amazed at the size. I would highly recommend this as a number one stay for Toronto if wanting spacious. Very clean, express check out fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the description”
Reviews.Author: traveler6307
Reviews.Content: Sutton Place has a reputation for being an older, swank hotel. But it's rundown and not worth the money. I booked into one of the apartments and found it not well equipped at all in the kitchen. No TV in the bedroom. Management was nice enough to book me into one of the hotel rooms for the same price, but overall this place isn't worth the money and isn't very convenient to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Weekend in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: TrippinCowboy
Reviews.Content: Wanted to do some shopping and visit a friend, was hoping for the Sheraton Centre again but got the Sutton Place thru Priceline, $83 USD per night all taxes & fees included. Good location, 1 block from Wellesley Station, don't use Bay station, it's 2.5 blocks. I discovered this myself after the first day. Check-in around 9pm was fine, not busy at all. Front desk girl fairly friendly and easy going. 5th floor room is clean and comfortable, I can see how this place would be considered 4-5 stars in the 80s, marble and granite everywhere but the gloomy wallpaper and ancient euro-style decor just isn't gonna cut it in a modern metropolis like Toronto. The bathroom is again full of marble but extremely small, shower pressure is barely tolerable for a 3 night stay. Towels are pretty thin and cheap feeling, sort of like a Best Western. There's a pretty useless wetbar hidden inside the cabinets with a mini-sink, I guess it's useful for the morning when dual vanity is needed if you have 2 people in the room. Housekeeping is pretty good, Lindor chocolates left on the bed each day. Minibar is locked with a seal so there's no confusion, if you don't touch it you won't be billed. Internet is only available through wireless, and the hotel charge $16 CAD for 24 hours. No thanks. Good thing being in Downtown Toronto you can also pick up the Toronto Hydro Telecom's One Zone Wireless for $9.99 CAD a day or $29.99 a month. Decent enough value but I had to sit close to the window for a good reception, the desk is inside next to the bathroom but there's another table by the window. Check out was smooth at 5am as I had to catch the early flight back. Doorman got a limo promptly on short notice. Excellent service. All in all a pretty good weekend stay, for the price. It's a slow weekend so even the hotel's own website had a promo rate of $102 CAD plus tax. But anything beyond that is pushing it. So look elsewhere if you don't want to try Priceline, you won't be happy paying $250+ a night here.

Reviews.Title: “Sutton Place”
Reviews.Author: dimi
Reviews.Content: Hotel was comfortable although it was better suited to business travelers, in my opinion. Location was good, but if you want to do some sightseeing you either walk a long distance, or go on the subway, which was very conveniently located one block from the hotel. I would stay again if I got as good of a rate as I did on priceline, otherwise, I wouldn't choose it for the hotel's standard rates. Parking rate was a bit high at $25 and I was charged a flat fee for a toll-free call (even though I didn't see anything that explained the rates would apply to toll-free in the room). Got a priceline rate of $70 for a night before taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: BorgsBearsted
Reviews.Content: Do not book this hotel expecting 5 star luxury. We stayed for 2 nights in one of the Grande Residence Studios - grande they ain't. The rooms were dated, fairly clean but not spotless - we loved the "special" touch of chewing gum stuck to the bed's headboard in our room - NOT!!! Communal areas fare better. Location is fairly central - just a short walk to Bloor, Yorkville and the Eaton Centre. Won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: mseibert
Reviews.Content: Stood one night (22nd-23rd-sept) for my wife's birthday and had a great time. The hotel was great. Only downside was the location. Pretty long walk to the Eaton Center and Queen Street Shopping. Very close to Bloor Street. Would not complain if I had to stay at that hotel again. Also, while walking around the hotel checking out the area, we found a little italian pizza/pasta place about 4 blocks from the hotel on Younge Street. Had a great gourmet pizza cooked in a wood burning oven. Room was very clean and very large. I requested a king room at check in and was given the upgrade even though I purchased my stay through priceline at a very low rate. Cant say anything bad about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: AlanNY
Reviews.Content: We visited Toronto for an extended weekend. When traveling as a family, we like staying in suites/apartments with kitchens so every meal is not spent in a restaurant or stuffing our faces with junk food. The one bedroom suite at the Sutton was very spacious for a family of four and comfortable enough to entertain a gathering of ten people. The decor was simple and the furnishing basic but were comfortable and more than met our needs. The hotels gym room was well maintained. The pool was small with very nice changing rooms and a roof deck that could be made more inviting. The location was great allowing us to take advantage of a truly walking city. The staff was friendly and the concierge helpful. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: shawnthavirgo
Reviews.Content: everything was great, from check-in to check out i felt like i was at home

Reviews.Title: “Good location, that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryTraveler10
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. Close to everything you need. Unfortunately, I have to agree with the majority of the other reviews here: It's not as clean as you would expect a 'five' star hotel, and the front desk employees are rude (regardless of how nice you are). Dollar for value... I'd stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Only 1 fault”
Reviews.Author: Ellaweeze
Reviews.Content: This was my first time visiting Toronto and I have to say that the Sutton Place is in a perfect position for visiting all the sights. It is very close to Yonge St and Yorkville, if you like walking it is a nice walk to the Eaton Centre. It is not close to the waterfront but the subway system is easy to use, cheap and you can easily get from the hotel to Union Station. There is a super place to eat breakfast on Bloor St (opposite the museum) called Overeasy and only a 10 minute walk from the hotel. I thought the price of the breakfast in the hotel was a little much for what was offered. As for the hotel, the room was huge and clean, the only fault I could find is the bathroom is particularly small, especially in comparison to the size of the bedroom. The other areas of the hotel were also clean, although I never managed to find time to get to the swimming pool. If you're looking for a clean and reliable hotel I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Was Great!!”
Reviews.Author: TRVLINCANUCK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a one night stay at this hotel for our 10th yr anniversary. I booked through hotels.ca and had advised that we were celebrating a special occasion. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a executive suite. Our room wasn't ready, as we were early, so they took our luggage for us and we proceeded to go shopping :) When we got back our room was ready and there were choc. covered strawberries in the room. Yes, there are expensive snack items, but no tricks, as there is a price list right with them. If you don't want to pay for them....don't eat them. Mini bar was there but we didn't open it so I don't know what was in it. Room was great, 2 big windows with nice city views. Plenty of closet space. Front desk staff, was efficient and friendly. Maid service was very friendly and seemed to enjoy their jobs. Kudos to the concierge for her Toronto Tips and extensive knowledge. We will be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Sutton was perfect to us”
Reviews.Author: Phillyboy51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton for a week in June 2007. It was one of the best hotels we have ever visited. We found the staff universally pleasant, helpful and professional. We arrived at a very busy time. The door staff was contending with a large crowd and apologized constantly for keeping us waiting - which was hardly any time at all! The room we booked with a kitchen and balcony wasn't ready. Yet the young woman at the desk (Vida?) patiently worked with Housekeeping to quickly find us a room matching our criteria. The room was fantastic: a huge comfortable 1 bedroom apartment with full kitchen, living room, dining area. enormous separate bedroom and tons of closets. The bed was one of the best our busted up bodies have slept in. We also had our balcony from which to enjoy a week of absolutely beautiful sunrises. The food from Room Service was very good and delivered quickly by friendly people. The Housekeepers on our floor were always helpful and extremely courteous. The location is perfect. Museums, downtown, Kensington Market -- we walked to everything. Nonetheless, cabs, buses and subways are close. When we needed directions to Niagara Falls, the friendly staff gave us a sheet with perfect directions. My wife and I are hard working family people. When we travel we look for comfort and warmth, both in the hotel and the staff. We found both at the Toronto Sutton. We plan to visit Montreal next . If Sutton had a location there, we'd book it!

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ruchdabomb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights for a conference after two nights at the Sheraton (one at the towne center, where the tub didn't drain and another at the airport). The Sutton place was fantastic. The rooms are beautiful - really large, with good light, done up in cream with blue curtains and marble/granite tables and a dresser. The staff is extremely helpful - from printing something for me when the business center was closed to helping us find a cab when the subway system suddenly broke during rush hour. The only thing I have against the hotel is that the internet is wireless and can only be connected to one computer/code. This likely won't be much of a problem for anyone other than myself because there were two people attending a conference in our room. The breakfast room service was a really good value compared to other hotels in the area, as well as the room service in general. We had a great time and would love to stay at the Sutton Place again if we are in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Not satisfied with the front desk lady: Karen”
Reviews.Author: NMMM
Reviews.Content: we met some tricks when living there. they provide a basket of expensive small items on the desk, for example: snacks, chips, at an unbelievable expensive price. what is more, they have a locked mini bar. They charged us for that one, however, we did not even open the mini bar, we were careful not to use or touch any potentially paid items there, which gave our honey week trip quite some troubles. EVEN worse is the front desk lady' s attitude while we doubted about the additional charge on "mini bar". She was rude, very rude. Her name is something like Karen. To, summarize, I dont like this hotel. room is small, a lot of tricks in all the room utilities there. It is not a good way to make money like that by tricks and cheatings.

Reviews.Title: “Five star prices, one star service”
Reviews.Author: roomtoread
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel screams "Faded Glory". Upon check-in , there is one clerk with six guest in line, and she is taking her time. The rooms smell like Grandma's attic, complete with 1960s bedspreads (floral, ugh!). When I ask why my room does not have a mini-bar, I am told that mini-bars "are not available on the fourth floor". So I call room service, and am told that the only beer they have is warm, and that they will have to charge me a delivery fee, even though I complain that other rooms have mini-bars and don't have delivery fees. After an 18 hour work day, I don't need these hassles. I would never stay here again. In fact, I will probably change hotels tomorrow. Life is too short to stay in crappy hotels with indifferent service.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fine, front desk clerk, rude, rude, rude!”
Reviews.Author: sontorn
Reviews.Content: My son and I found the hotel on the web. Booked 2 rooms on priceline and paid in advance. At the front desk, we were told by the extremely rude clerk, that only one room was booked. I had the copy in front of me, but it didn't seem to matter to her. She acted like we were lowlife. Finally, Priceline straightened it out. I then had to wait in my son's room for another hour for a total of 2 hours from the time we walked into the hotel. I have never seen such rudeness from a person working with the public. She acted as though we caused a problem for her. Customer relations, what a joke! We are from the states and found Toronto extremely friendly. Perhaps she should move to the North Pole! The hotel was fine, but because of her attitude, we will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: JerryFan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sutton Place Apr. 13-15. Because of reviews, asked for a renovated room with 2 doubles. Room was very nice--new carpet & bedding. Very clean. Staff was very cordial and helpful--common areas were lovely. Hotel is in a great location, with a little bakery and 24-hour store around the corner--subway 2 blocks, close to Bloor Street. Only issue was that my son had red, teary eyes for a whole night because of the chlorine in the pool--but when he wore goggles he was fine.

Reviews.Title: “C'mon . . . It's not that bad”
Reviews.Author: Aefaboy
Reviews.Content: I travel to Toronto quarterly for business and typically stay at either the Sheraton Center, Hilton, or Westin Harbour via priceline. This time it was Sutton Place - $60/night. After reading these posts, I was terrified. It's may not be a 4 star property, but it isn't Bond Place. The Lobby is inviting with lots of marble, wall mosaics and nice large open spaces. Although the sixth floor hallway appeared dated the rooms were fine. The "tone" of the room IS diffferent from the warm / dark colors of the Sheraton, Hilton and Westin. The light colored furniture reminded me of the "provincial" feel of a London or Paris hotel room. The room was in no way old or outdated, Sutton Place has choosen a different more European feel. The location was great. One block from Younge Street, maybe six blocks north of the Financial district.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels EVER! Horrible Service and outdated”
Reviews.Author: kellamonster
Reviews.Content: I travel 75% of the month and stay in all sorts of hotels from boutique hotels to major chains. This by far is THE WORST. Since we walked in the door there have been problems and no one seems too concerned. They lost one of our reservations, the heater didn't work in one of the rooms (and it's so cold in Toronto right now), problems with the internet that they charge $16 for, etc. etc. It is laughable how horrible this hotel is. They need to rennovate the hotel and hire a new more competent, caring staff.

Reviews.Title: “Damp and Outdated”
Reviews.Author: Krustywalnuts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton Hotel in mid december 2006 last year. The hotel rooms are in serious need of upgrades and renovations. The bed was as hard as a rock and the room was very damp (musty) and dirty with out dated furniture. The front desk staff we're rude. This hotel doesn't even come close to the Sheraton or Weston Harbour Castle which we had previously stayed at in Toronto won through priceline.com. How can this hotel be rated a 5*, it's a 3* at best.

Reviews.Title: “Sutton Place - a delight”
Reviews.Author: linda macdonald
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sutton Place Dec 24 - 26, 2006 in room 724. It was spacious and tastefully decorated in shades of taupe and navy blue. Plenty of lamp light, black out curtains, coffee maker with Seattle's Best Coffee, large TV, clock radio, mini bar and wet bar area. The king size bed was heavenly, and I swear, the comforter weighed 15 lb! The floor to ceiling marble bathroom was small but all-inclusive. The toileteries are from Gilchrist & Soames and bear the Queen's Coat of Arms. If it's good enough for her... Dinner at in-house Accents dining room was marvelous, and like all upscale hotels, overpriced, but worth it. Located at Bay & Wellesley, it's an excellent location for visiting government types as Queen's Park is right across the street or for those who love to shop on Bloor St's Golden Mile. I know that all opinions are relative to one's experience, so the previous cranky reviews are a mystery to me. I had a perfectly delightful time, and am glad I chose Sutton Place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: mentaltraveller
Reviews.Content: We used to stay here regularly but never again. The last three visits we spent hours trying to get their internet to work, The usual excuse is either a) it works perfectly or b) the building is made of steel and concrete and thatâ€™s why it doesnâ€™t work(!?) or c) weâ€™re in a room with poor reception. The internet simply did not function at all this last visit. We never have any problems with internet at any other hotel (presumably also made of steel and concrete!, and they donâ€™t charge $16.95) But it was the last straw this time when the phones did not work, neither did the kettle. Repeated visits to Housekeeping, the Front Desk, Guest Services Manager and finally the Manager himself resulted in absolutely nothing. No solutions. Someone simply came and moved the broken phones around. Very bad attitude, I donâ€™t think they need guests to run the hotel. Also at check in, the lobby was empty and there were no doormen around and we were staggering under bags. Front desk was unhelpful and curt. The concierge arranged for a taxi to the airport that came late, tried to overcharge us $5 and was a run down, filthy vehicle. The carpet in the room was stained with a lot of fluorescent paint, and one of the two usual armchairs was missing. We were kept up by the noise and overpowering cigarette smoke in the hallways and other rooms. This hotel did not seem like a safe, clean and secure environment at all.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: atoti
Reviews.Content: I had been told that the Sutton Place Grande in Toronto was definitely the place to stay unfortunately my experience indicates otherwise. Upon check-in, the hotel reception staff was very cold and serious albeit polite, compared to my previous stay at the the Hilton, the week before. I was given a very mediocre room on the 6th floor, that was not partcularily attractive and not that clean. Upon finding hair in the tub, sink and toilet seat, I phoned the front desk to alert them and they did indeed suggest that I change rooms. They gave me a room on the same floor with the same problems. This time I went to the front desk in person and was told that my situation was not possible since all rooms were inspected by a Housekeeping supervisor before being let out. That was the end of that conversation and without anyone even offering to clean my room. The concierge in the evening period was abrupt and condescending when I asked directions for the Eaton Centre. She suggested I shop in Yorkville instead. (I did not realize the shops in Yorkvile were open past 6 pm on a Monday evening). These may seem like minor and petty annoyances but they coloured my stay and I did not enjoy the experience.

Reviews.Title: “underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: SP66
Reviews.Content: Not a 5 star hotel by any means. I'm not normally a 5 star kind of traveller, but I booked myself a getaway, hoping for a bit of luxury and pampering - the Sutton Place did not meet my expectations, unfortunately. The room smelled musty, the bathroom was clean but small, the beds were comfy - nice pillows - extras in the closet, along with a nice woolen blanket. No bathrobes even though they were listed on expedia as part of the room amenities. The service at reception made me wonder why on earth these people were working in the service industry - barely an acknowledgment when checking in - no eye contact, heaven forbid they could crack a smile - bad form. Fitness centre was small but clean - pool was small and clean as well- no good for exercise, but nice for floating about and staring at the ceiling. Breakfast in Accents restaurant was below average - had a microwaved feel to it, actually - disappointing. Overall it was an average stay - I wouldn't recommend this hotel - it's rather forgettable. A change in attitude from the people who work there would go a long way to improving the overall feel of the Sutton place.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star...maybe 3 or 4.”
Reviews.Author: Melissaif
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were told we could self-park by the Valet attendant, but he failed to tell us that the elevator was out, and we would have to carry our luggage (10 days worth for 4 people) up a flight of stairs. If we had known, we would have left it at the door. Rooms were fair, but definitely older. Mine had a dated kitchenette. My bathroom was splashed with water when I entered, and it looked like perhaps someone had run the shower with the curtain open. I called the front desk and they sent in engineering. We had some kind of miscommunication, most likely perpetuated by a language barrier. The hotel moved my room, but did not explain that they were moving me. Upon meeting my party for dinner in the lobby, a man came up to me and tried to hand me a key and named off my room as well as another member of my party's room. I was confused and told them I was not moving, and the other members of my party became VERY confused. The man did not seem to understand me. Also, some people live in this hotel (it doubles as apartments), so I'm not sure if there is any such thing as a non-smoking floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, fair room”
Reviews.Author: RandT
Reviews.Content: I opted for this property because they are supportive of the gay/lesbian community and was recommended. I was disappointed in the hotel facilities; this is no 4 or 5 star. I have stayed in nicer 3 star hotels. Our third floor room had the view of an outside wall and the roof of the building next door. The size was adequate for a double but the wall paper was peeling as was the paint. It looked like the bathroom may have been recently renovated as it was quite nice, not overly large but adequate for what you need. The pleasant surprise was the staff; we were treated like we were the most valued guests, they were very friendly and helpful...they even got us into a room at 10 in the morning which was very nice considering we had been flying for over 14 hours. The housekeeping staff visited our room at least twice a day to clean and make the beds and again in the evening to turn them down and we always had clean towels. We didn't eat in the restaurant as I hate hotel restaurants in general, they have wireless internet but at $16.50 per 24 hours is was over priced, I had to use it one day for business but would have been nice to have it available all the time for free (i.e. like Best Western does). The location is excellent, close to shopping and the gay village. I got their promotional rate of $197 CA per night which I don't think was a great value. I would probably stay here again if I could get a better rate but there are many more value hotels located in the area which I would consider.

Reviews.Title: “first class accomodation”
Reviews.Author: moople
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights on a short break to Toronto, lovely comfortable well maintained rooms there was no shortage of clean linen and fluffy towels all of the best quality, found all the staff helpful and polite. we used the pool, sauna and the gym all of which were clean well maintained would definately return to The Sutton Place again. There are a few little breakfast places further up Bay St which were very reasonable for bacon eggs fried potatoes toast only $3.75each, the Panorama Restaurant on Bay St with stunning views around the city served lovely food although they charged a $5 dollar cover charge each person it was worth it, TheFoxes Den pub also serves a wide variety of dishes at very reasonable prices, The Sutton Place is a great base for any trip to Toronto

HotelInfo.Name: The Sutton Place Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 955 Bay Street, Toronto, Ontario M5S 2A2, Canada
